loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий фермер. Занимается выращиванием петрушки, укропа и кинзы более 5 лет.
 В  его семье двое детей - младшему 2.5, старшему 8 лет. 
Земельный участок достался Василию по наследству от родителей.
Для  вспашки  и обработки фрезой  земельного участка приобрел мотоблок. 
Уже в этом году Василий планирует высаживать саженцы   земляники и малины.
В личных планах - увеличение благосостояния семьи, завершить строительство дома.
texts.en: Vasiliy is a farmer.  He has been involved in growing parsley, dill and coriander for over five years.  He has two children: the youngest is 2.5 and the oldest is 8 years old.  Vasiliy inherited his land from his parents.  He purchased mechanized farming equipment with a cutter to plow and treat the land.  Vasiliy plans to plant to strawberry and raspberry seedlings this year.  His personal plans include improving his family's welfare and completing the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. Margaret will use the loan to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy cows and build a house. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Margret's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 51 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her. She and her husband plant cabbage as the main source of their family’s income and, to better support the family, they sometimes work for others to gain additional income. Touch has been in this business for 20 years, earning a daily income of around 25,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses. 

This is Touch's second loan with VisionFund, but it is her two group members' first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Touch is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Simon Pierre

texts.en:
Simon Pierre is 25 years old and is single. He owns a business charging car batteries. Simon Pierre has two years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Simon Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy new machines to charge car batteries. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy new machines to charge car batteries.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as snack foods and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing both the size of her store and its sales and in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as snack foods, to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy entusiasta, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Tiene su pareja de 25 años llamado Wellington, con quien vive hace un año. Ella tiene dos hijos pequeños, a quienes brinda todo su amor y cuidado, todos viven en la casa que logró obtener y construir con ayuda de su ex pareja luego de muchos años de esfuerzo y trabajo constante.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado fresco. Todos los días se dirige al puerto pesquero de la ciudad para adquirir los pescados al por mayor, luego se encarga de distribuirlos por especies y tamaños, finalmente los pone a la venta por kilos llegando muchas veces a triplicar su inversión inicial. Sus clientes varían entre los compradores eventuales y comerciantes de pescado de la ciudad, tiene como principal herramienta su gran carisma y elocuencia para acceder a los clientes. Durante los 10 años que lleva en este trabajo ha aprendido mucho sobre el manejo y las temporadas de pesca, tanto así que de no saber nada de lo que hacía, se convirtió en una excelente administradora de su negocio y siempre recibe buenas ganancias por su trabajo. Para el futuro espera obtener su puesto de ventas en algún mercado y posteriormente, su primer bote de pesca.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.

El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de pescado de las especies más solicitadas.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 38, is a very enthusiastic, enterprising, and hard-working woman.  She has lived with her 25 year old life partner, Wellington, for one year.  She has two young children to whom she gives all of her love and care.  They all live in the house that she managed to get and to build with help from her ex life partner.  She got the house after many years of great effort and constant work.

Her work consists of selling fresh fish.  Every day she heads to the city’s fishing port to get the fish wholesale.  Then she takes charge of arranging them by species and sizes.  Finally, she sells them by the kilo, and she often triples her initial investment.

Her customers are prospective buyers and fish merchants from the city.  Her primary tool is her great charisma and her eloquence in gaining access to the customers.  During the ten years that she has done the work she has learned a lot about managing it and about the fishing seasons.

She went from not knowing anything about what she did to becoming an excellent administrator of her business.  She always receives good income for her work.  In the future she hopes to get a sales stand at a market.  After that she hopes to get her first fishing boat.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity and the trust that has been placed in her.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  It pleases her to be part of the communal bank that she belongs to because the members are responsible and supportive of each other.

She will use the requested 500 soles to buy the species of fish that are most requested.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ignat

texts.ru:
Игнат сельский фермер.  Занимается выращиванием земляники, картошки, лука и сладкой кукурузы. 
По хозяйству ему помогают двое сыновей 24-х и 27-ми лет.
На своих новых земельных участках Игнат дополнительно высадил землянику.   Для вспашки и культивации земли нужно приобрести мотоблок.
В хозяйственных планах - расширить посадку земляники, картофеля и арбуза. 
В личных планах - постройка нового дома для жилья.
texts.en: Ignat is a village farmer.  He is involved in growing strawberries, potatoes, onions and sweet corn.  His two sons, who are 24 and 27 years old, help him with the business.  Ignat planted additional strawberries on his new land plots.  He needs to purchase mechanized farming equipment to pow and cultivate the soil.  His business plans are to expand the planting of strawberries, potatoes and watermelons.  His personal plans include building a new house to live in.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products, such as toothpaste, shampoos, and personal sanitary items to sell in her store. Yen's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, shampoo, and personal sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sokhom is 54 years old and married. He has seven children, six of whom are dependent on him and they work in a garment factory and for others for pay.  Sokhom is a rice farmer and he supplements his family’s income by planting spices to earn extra income. He has been in this business for almost 33 years. 

Sokhom received his first loan from VisionFund four cycles ago and completely paid back his loans. He successfully used the loans to support his business and family. Now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR for each member of his group, Sokhom, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to grow his business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en:
Sineat, aged 34, is the breadwinner of his family of two dependent children, one daughter and one son. He lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. His daughter is still in school while his son is not yet of school age. For the past 10 years, Sineat and his wife have earned a living by planting beans and cucumbers, earning nearly 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sineat's first loan with VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy seeds for farming and to repair his house. Sineat hopes to grow his business and earn more income to make a better living and to keep his daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds for farming and to repair his house

loans.name: My

texts.en: My is requesting a new loan to buy foods and beverages to restock her stall. This purchase will help her to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of vegetarian food products. My hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and its sales and in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy foods and beverages to sell from her stall

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is a 38-year-old married woman who has two daughters. She lives with her family in the city of Ho Chi Minh. For the past 3 years, Huyen has supported her family by running a business selling rice in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to enable her to buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell at higher margins. Huyen hopes this loan will enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sam, 49, is widowed and has five dependent children, two daughters and three sons. Three of the children are still in school. Rice farming is the family's only source of income. Having been in this business for 17 years, Sam is able to make a daily income of 16,000 KHR and manages to save about half of it for future needs. 

Sam has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has completely repaid her loans, which have enabled her to manage some savings. Sam and her two group members, who have been with VisionFund for one to three loan cycles, are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sam is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to purchase gasoline for a pumping machine to carry water into her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthy rice and to sell it for a good price to make a better living and to build on some savings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Association Femmes Sengaz N°9 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement "Association femmes sengaz n°9" est composé de cinq femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de famille.
Elles s'occupent à longueur de journée des taches ménagères.Mais,durant l'hivernage, elles gèrent une exploitation agricole dans laquelle elle cultivent un champs d'arachide situé non loin du village.Elles produisent ainsi de la paille d'arachide et des graines qu'elles vendent sur les marchés locaux.Elles arrivent à générer des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs familles.Elles sollicitent ainsi un pret de 250000 f pour acheter des semences d'arachides.Elles envisagent d'étendre cette année leur champs.
texts.en:
Group "Association femmes sengaz n°9" is composed of five women. They are all married and have families.
All day long, they are busy with housework, but during the rainy season, they farm a ground nut field located near their village. In it, they produce ground nut straw and seeds which they sell at local markets. They have been successful in generating revenues which allow them to provide for themselves and their families.
They are requesting a loan of 250,000 XOF to purchase ground nut seeds. This year, they are planning on extending their field.

loans.use: to buy ground nut seeds.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 56 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y con mucha experiencia en los negocios. Su pareja es Dennis, de 54 años, quien es pescador. Vive en compañía de sus padres, su pareja y sus hijos de 19 y 16 años, en la casa que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja tras muchos años de trabajo.

Su negocio consiste en la venta de pescado, para ello cuenta con un bote pesquero en el que se transporta a algún río o lago al lado de su pareja y dos ayudantes, con todos los materiales de pesca para realizar una buena faena; luego los vende, al por mayor, en algún mercado de la ciudad. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 20 años, sin embargo, en esta rutina ha descubierto, no hace muchos años, la oportunidad de vender ropa de segundo uso, ya que en las zonas aledañas a los ríos en los que pesca, los pobladores de esos caseríos le solicitan las prendas, ellas consigue la ropa en centros comerciales de la ciudad y luego las vende en cada centro poblado que visita, realiza esta labor hace 2 años. Le gustan ambas actividades que realiza, ya que la mantiene ocupada, lo que no le agrada, según comenta, es que algunas veces no ha logrado pescar lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos, muchas veces debido a la escasez de los peces o a la creciente de los ríos, pero eso no la desanima.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1200) comprará redes nuevas para continuar pescando.
texts.en:
Carmen is 56 years old.  She is a happy, friendly woman with a lot of business experience. Her partner Dennis, 54, is a fisherman. She lives with her parents, her partner and her two children, who are 19 and 16 years old. They live in a house that she, with the support of her partner, succeeded in building after many years of working.

Carmen’s business involves the sale of fish. She has a fishing boat which she takes to a river or lake, together with her partner and two helpers as well as all the fishing gear they need to do good work. Later she sells the catch, wholesale, to a market in the city.  She has been doing this work for 20 years. Moreover, she has discovered in this routine an opportunity to sell second hand clothing because in the surrounding areas adjacent to the rivers where she fishes, the settlers ask her for garments. She buys clothing in commercial centers in the city and then sells it at each village she visits. She has had this business for two years.  She enjoys both businesses since they keep her busy. However what she does not like, she says, is that sometimes she fails to catch enough to cover expenses, often due to a lack of fish or the rising rivers, but that does not discourage her.

This is Carmen’s second loan from MFP, therefore she is grateful to those who make it possible. She is very committed, one more time, to making her payments on time and she is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very good, friendly and supportive people.

With the sum requested, (S/. 1,200), she will by nets to continue fishing.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un  menuisier et ont ensemble un enfant de 18mois.
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse d’œufs frais et de glaçons. Elle exerce l’activité à domicile et est à son troisième crédit de WAGES. Ce montant lui servira à acheter des œufs frais. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, augmenter son stock et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi, age 35, is married to a carpenter. The couple have an 18-month-old child. She sells fresh eggs and ice cubes from her home, ans she is seeking a third loan from WAGES to replenish her stock of fresh eggs. 

Ablavi plans to reinvest in her activity, increase her stock, and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh eggs for resale.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 41 year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Anh and her husband earn a living running a business of selling sewing threads, which they have done for 8 years.

Anh would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity of thread to sell. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of thread to sell.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is a 35 year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 1 daughter. Her husband earns a living working as a carpenter. Huyen supports her family by running a general store in the local community, which she has done for 5 years. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products, such as sugar, milk, soft-drink and snack foods, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of products, such as sugar, milk, soft-drink and snack food to sell from her store.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of household items to sell from her stall. Gai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of household items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sovann Pheakdey's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of a family in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sovann Pheakdey is 46 years old and married with one son. To make a living, he has been farming rice with his wife on five-hectare farmland for seven years. This business earns him around 38,000 KHR per day to spend for daily basic needs. The main challenge for his family's business is the lack of working capital.

This is the first loan for Sovann Pheakdey's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He is leading his group of two members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farming business. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yield and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farming business.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Bernadette fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «peuple uni (United people)». Elle a 42 ans, elle est marie avec 3 enfants de 4 ans à 20 ans, dont 2  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.
Bernadette est agriculteur de pommes de terre. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 300kgs des semences des pommes de terre, 51kgs des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture, elle planifie d’acheter 2 champs et demander d’autres prêts. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être le grand distributeur des pommes des terres dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Bernadette is a member of the Abunzubumwe group.  The group's name means "united people".  She is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 20, two of whom are in school.  She has eight years of primary education.

Bernadette grows rice.  This is her first loan cycle through ACB.  She will use her loan to buy 300 kg of seed potatoes and 51 kg of chemical fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.  To grow her farming business, she plans to buy two fields and take out additional loans.  In the coming years, she would like to be the main potato distributor in her area.  With the profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy 300 kg of seed potatoes, 51 kg of chemical fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, tiene una relación de convivencia desde hace 25 años con Javier, de 55 años, es madre de tres hijos de 16, 12 y 6 años. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia, la que construyó con apoyo de su pareja en el terreno de su suegra, y día a día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor sí para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida (carne asada, papas fritas con salchichas, entre otros) por la noche, en la vereda de su casa. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años y le permite poder generar buenos ingresos a su hogar, ya que antes de tener este empleo vendía frutas pero dejó esta actividad porque no le producía las ganancias que esperaba o en el peor de los casos tenía que esperar el dinero que le proporcionaba su pareja como resultado de su trabajo como carpintero y a veces no alcanzaba para todos los gastos. Ahora tiene un ingreso adicional y además le permite poder tener alimento a disposición para su familia, ya que no gastan ni en cena, ni desayuno. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que siempre le ha gustado la cocina, tiene muchos planes con su negocio, pero por el momento solo desea reunir mayor capital para hacerlo crecer.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) implementará su local, comprando un par de mesas y algunas sillas para atender a sus comensales. Comprará también los ingredientes que a diario usa en la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Norma, 40, is a very kind and hard working woman. She has been in a common-law relationship for 25 years with Javier, 55, and she's the mother of three children aged 16, 12, and 6 years old. She lives with her family in their own house, which she built with her partner in her mother-in-law's land. She works very hard on a daily basis to give the best of herself for her children to have a better quality of life.

Her business is to sell food (grilled meat, french fries with sausage, among others) during the night on the sidewalk of her house. She has been in this business for three years, which allows her to earn an income for her home. She used to sell fruits, but she stopped because it was not providing the expected earnings. In the worst case scenario, she had to wait for the money her partner earned as a carpenter, which was not enough to cover all of the household expenses. She really enjoys what she does, since she has always liked to cook. She has many plans for her business, but for the time being, only wants to gather enough capital to expand it.

This is her fourth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFI). She's grateful to those who make it possible for her to reach her objectives. She's very committed, once again, to pay her loan as promptly as before. She's very happy to be part of the communal bank, since all of the members are very good, kind, and supportive.

With the amount requested (1500 Soles), she will set up a locale, buying a couple of tables and some chairs to cater to her customers. She will also buy some of the ingredients used to prepare the meals every day.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her locale and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор более 30 лет занимается фермерством.  В  своих теплицах  он выращивает огурцы, капусту и лук.
По хозяйству ему помогают двое его детей - 19 и 20 лет.  Они студенты,  учатся  в агротехнической академии.
Обрабатывать земельный участок очень тяжело, поэтому  Виктор решил приобрести  мотоблок для вспашки и фрезеровки земли в теплице.  Генератор нужен на  случай, если  прекращается  подача электроэнергии.

Виктор мечтает заняться выращиванием клубники в теплице, а также расширить свой земельный участок.

В личных планах:  развитие своего хозяйства - поставить еще две теплицы на новых земельных участках.

Нуждается в вашей помощи, чтобы приобрести  мотоблок и генератор.
texts.en: Victor has been involved in farming for over 30 years.  He grows cucumbers, cabbage and onions in his greenhouses.  Two of his children, who are 19 and 20 years old, help him with the business.  They are both students, attending an agricultural academy.  It is very difficult to treat the land, and this is why Victor decided to purchase mechanized farming equipment for plowing and cutting the land in a greenhouse.  He needs a generator in case the supply of electricity is interrupted.  Victor dreams of getting involved in growing strawberries in a greenhouse and also of expanding his land plot.  His personal plans include developing his business by building two more greenhouses on new land plots.  He needs your help to purchase mechanized farming equipment and a generator.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment and a generator

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Marié à une coiffeuse et père de 02enfants qui sont scolarisés, Mr Ablam est agent commercial. Pour mieux jouer son rôle de père de famille, il a décidé en 2006 de vendre des pièces détachées frigorifiques à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Sa difficulté est le manque de fonds pour pouvoir augmenter son stock. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, il sollicite son second crédit de WAGES pour acheter des gaz réfrigérants. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer les besoins élémentaires des enfants. Ses enfants sont âgés de 06 et 04ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablam is a commercial agent. He is married to a hairdresser, and the couple have two children aged 4 and 6 who both go to school. 

To provide for his family, he decided in 2006 to sell spare components used for refrigeration. He works out of his shop and sells to anyone. At present time, the obstacle he is facing is a lack of funds to bolster his stock. 

He is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy refrigerant gases. This will help him to meet the needs of his customers. He wants to reinvest in his activity and provide for his children’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration components for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame  Fatou est mariée  et vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans.  Elle  vend des  habits de friperie. Elle est mère de famille et a en charge une famille élargie. Les revenus de son activité l’aident à faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour acheter  des  balles d’habits  qui seront destinés a la vente  pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices dans le but de développer d’avantage son activité de commerce. Son plus grand souhait est de disposer dans le futur d’un grand magasin de vente d’habits.
texts.en: Fatou is married and lives in Senegal. She has been in commerce for over 20 years now. She sells secondhand clothing. She is a mother and in charge of a large family. The revenue from her business helps her to cover the daily expenses for her family. She is a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC, and she is seeking 400,000 frs to buy bundles of clothing to resell for her business. Her goal is to increase her profit in the hopes of developing her business more. Her biggest wish is to own a large clothing store in the future.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing intended for resale

loans.name: Lors

texts.en:
Lors, 43, lives with his family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. His current business is to provide construction services to people around the province. He has a team providing these services, and earns approximately USD 5.00 per day. Married to a local rice farmer, he has five single children, three of whom are working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh to help the family, while the other two are still attending the local school.

With his fourth loan from HKL, Lors would like to purchase building supplies such as timbers and floorboards to renovate and expand his house. He hopes to provide improved living conditions for his children through his efforts and with the help of the loan. In the future, he aims to become financially stable so that he can educate his children to at least the high school level.

loans.use: to purchase building supplies such as timbers and floorboards to renovate and expand his house.

loans.name: Youm's Group

texts.en:
Youm, aged 55, is married and has six children. He lives with his family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

He and his wife earn a living to support their big family through farming rice and performing traditional music during weddings for a fee. He has been in rice farming and traditional music for thirty-three years and twenty-eight years, respectively. This business earns him a daily income of around 20,000 KHR. 

This is the fourth loan for Youm with VisionFund. He successfully used the past loans to better support his family and children and he completely paid back VisionFund. 

He is leading his other group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farming business. With this loan, he hopes to grow more rice and increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 40 years old and is married with five children aged between 5 years and 18 years old. He takes care of seven relatives. 

He owns a restaurant selling cakes, bread, bananas, etc. Eric has three years of experience in this work and he currently employs three people to help him. 

Eric has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his restaurant by buying more cakes, bread, bananas, etc. for resale. 

With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to expand his restaurant by buying more cakes, bread, bananas, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 29 años, es una mujer amable, servicial y muy trabajadora. Su pareja hace 15 años es Antonio, de 31 años, fruto de su amor tiene tres hijos menores. Vive junto a toda su familia en su humilde casa, la cual lograron construir luego de muchos años de trabajo y esfuerzo, toda su familia es muy unida y entre todos buscan progresar cada día más.

Su trabajo es la compra y venta de pescado. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse al puerto pesquero de la ciudad para conseguir los pescados más frescos y más grandes, compra al por mayor y luego los vende en el mercado más concurrido del pueblo. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable porque todos los días tiene clientes y además porque sus ganancias son muy buenas. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 6 años y siempre ha trabajado con su pareja, quien la ayuda a cargar las pesadas bandejas repletas de pescado fresco. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, la única dificultad que encuentra es que tiene que levantarse muy temprano; sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y tiene que continuar poniéndole muchas ganas para conseguir el dinero suficiente que su familia requiere para cubrir sus necesidades. Para más adelante espera poder comprar su propio bote de pesca.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibirlo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) comprará pescados más grandes y en mayor cantidad para continuar su negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 29 years old and a friendly, cooperative and very hardworking woman. Her partner of 15 years is Antonio, who is 31. They have three young children. The family lives in a modest house, which they succeeded in building after many years of work and effort. The family members are very united and look for ways to move forward everyday.

Consuelo’s work is buying and selling fish. Every day she gets up very early to go to the city’s fishing port to buy the freshest and biggest fish. She buys wholesale and then sells in the city’s busiest market. She considers her work to be very profitable because she has customers every day and also because her earnings are very good. She has had this business almost six years and she has always worked with her partner, who helps her carry the heavy trays full of fresh fish. She really enjoys what she does. The only difficulty she finds is that she has to get up so early. Nevertheless, she realizes that is her job and it is what she has to do to earn enough money to cover her family’s needs. In the future she hopes to be able to buy her own fishing boat.

This is her first loan from MFP. Consequently she is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence shown in her. She promises to make all her payments on time and is glad to be part of the communal bank she belongs to because the members are  responsible and supportive.

With the sum solicited, (S/. 800) she will purchase larger fish and buy in bulk in order to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, sobre todo muy trabajadora. Tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la casa que construyó junto a su ex esposo, allí vive con sus dos hijos mayores y sus nietos.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes y cerveza, su negocio está en su misma vivienda, la que se encuentra ubicada en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, por lo que todos los días atiende a muchos clientes. Aun recuerda cuando emprendió este negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años, tuvo muchas dificultades que con el pasar del tiempo pudo superarlas, ahora su tienda es muy visitada, pues ofrece gran variedad de productos a buen precio y sobre todo que la atención es siempre desde muy temprano. Así también, de forma eventual, realiza trabajos de costura, ya sea confeccionando prendas de su propia creación o elaborando alguna ropa a pedido. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que le permite dedicar su tiempo a múltiples actividades del hogar, además le está yendo muy bien, ya que genera muchos ingresos para su familia. Ahora tiene muchos planes para su negocio, entre ellos está la ampliación de su local y así poder vender en mayor cantidad.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas y abarrotes para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Rayda is 54 years old. She is kind, humble, and above all a hard worker. She has four children and lives in the house she built with her ex-husband. She lives there with her two older children and grandchildren. 

She sells groceries and beverages. She runs her business from her house located in a very popular street of the city, which is why she has clients every day. She still remembers when she started her business about five years ago. She encountered many challenges, but with time she has managed to overcome them. Currently, her store is frequently visited given the large product variety at good prices and above all, that service is always available from early in the morning. 

Additionally, as an alternative, she works as a seamstress, either making clothing from her own designs or by customer order. She enjoys what she does, since it gives her the option to use her time in multiple activities from home. She's doing very well, since she earns a considerable income for her family. She has many plans for her business, among them to expand her locale and thus be able to sell more products. 

This is her fourth credit with the MFI and she's very happy to have financial backing, which enables her to move forward with her business. Likewise, she is committed to promptly pay her loan payments, in line with previous loans. She's also very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very responsible and supportive.

With the amount requested (2000 PEN), she will buy more beverages and groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema, who appears in the picture, is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to one son and six daughters. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

Kareema wants to live with her family in suitable home conditions, so she is requesting a USD $500 loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of repairing and improving the house's condition, such as installing tiles and painting. 

This will offer to Kareema and her family comfortable home living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the house.

loans.name: Josinta's Group

texts.en:
Josinta's group is comprised of six hardworking women. Josinta is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. 

For the past two years, Josinta has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry food like cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Josinta has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour for resale, and will help Josinta to generate greater profits and earn money for her medical expenses. Josinta hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Josinta is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Josinta's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 44 años, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Se encuentra separada hace muchos años de quien fue su pareja, con la que tuvo cuatro hijos, siendo dos de ellos ya mayores de edad. Vive en compañía de sus dos menores hijos en la casa que le dejó su ex pareja. 

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes en general y bebidas, para eso estableció una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, ahí atiende todos los días, desde muy temprano, de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, con quienes tiene una relación de amistad y respeto durante los 6 años que viene funcionando su bodega. Generalmente atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hija. Así también desde hace un año trabaja por las noches en la atención al público en un restaurante de su ciudad, ambos trabajos le generan los ingresos necesarios para poder llevar una vida confortable para ella y sus hijos. Le agrada su negocio  de ventas de abarrotes ya que le permite estar en casa durante el día y participar en las actividades escolares de su hija y de su hogar. Así mismo, el ingreso económico que obtiene le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos, ya que con la pensión alimenticia que recibe mensualmente de su ex pareja no lograba cubrir todos los gastos familiares, por ello decidió trabajar para no seguir pasando necesidades. Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta la fecha tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y realizar la ampliación y mejora de su pequeña tienda.

Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará mayor cantidad de diferentes productos y abarrotes para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 44-year-old woman who is enterprising, cheerful, and above all very hardworking. She has been separated for many years from the father of her four children, two of whom are already adults. She lives with her two younger children in the house that her ex-husband left her.

Her business is the sale of groceries and drinks, for which she established a small shop in her residence. Starting very early, she helps all her customers there every day in a friendly and cordial way. For the most part, her customers are her neighbors, with whom she has had a friendly and respectful relationship for the six years that her store has been in business. She generally works alone, but on occasion her daughter helps her. For the past year, she has also worked evenings serving the public in a restaurant in her city. Both jobs generate the income necessary to be able to provide a comfortable life for herself and her children. She enjoys her grocery-selling business because it allows her to be at home during the day and to participate in the school and household activities of her daughter. Also, the income she makes helps cover basic costs, since the support payments she receives every month from her ex-husband weren't covering all the family's expenses. That's why she decided to work rather than continue doing without. Seeing the good results that she has had to date, she has plans to continue with her business and expand and improve her little store.

This is the fifth loan with MFP and Sonia is very happy to know that she has financial support; that way she will feel more sure of continuing with her work. She also commits, once again, to repaying her loan punctually like she did before. In addition, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all the members are very responsible and supportive.

With the requested amount (1000 PEN), Sonia will purchase a greater quantity of different products and groceries in order to offer a better selection to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: María Herminia

texts.es:
María Herminia tiene 67 años de edad, es viuda y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia y muy cerca a su casa viven dos de sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Totoral Alto del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, vive en la parte rural del distrito y solo cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, caprino y porcino), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal son comercializados en el mercado local. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, el cual le produce leche fresca para su venta diaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 10 años en la ganadería. Estas actividades le sirven para mantenerse activa y poder ganarse su propio sustento. 

Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para el ganado menor. María Herminia agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en este crédito y envía bendiciones a los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
María Herminia is 67 years old, widowed, and without any dependent children. She lives in her house and two of her children live close by. Her house is in the village of Totoral Alto within the agricultural district of Tambogrande. She lives in the rural section of the district and the only service she receives is electricity.

She makes her living by raising and selling small livestock (sheep, goats, and pigs). When they reach the proper stage of development, they are sold in the local market. She also raises cattle, which provides her with fresh milk to sell on a daily basis. She has been raising livestock for more than 10 years. Her work helps her to remain active and earn her own income.

She's requesting a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa (MFI) to purchase balanced animal feed for the small livestock. María Herminia thanks the people who will support her with the loan and sends blessings to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed for the small livestock.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 35 years old. She lives in a small village of Khelvachauri District with her family: her husband, Iusup, and two children (11 and 14 years old). Both of them study in the local school. 

Elene and Iusup earn their living through a dairy farm with two milking cows from which they produce cheese. Part of the milk and cheese are used by the family and the rest is sold locally. Also, they have hens and sell eggs.

They also own a plot of land where they grow various vegetables and fruits: carrots, beets, cabbage, and mandarin. Ekaterine and Iusup are especially busy with the plot during spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer, when they sell on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari.

Ekaterine requested a loan for her agricultural business. With this loan she will be able to cultivate the family-owned land and sow more vegetables and fruits. Ekaterine and Iusup will work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons, to get a good harvest. After selling the harvest, the family will get planned income and Ekaterine will be able to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is from the village of Ude in the southern part of Georgia. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband Peter and 87-year-old mother-in-law. Tamar and Peter have children, but they are married and live separately. Tamar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her sales business start-up but had no success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tamar and Peter have a milk cow. Tamar produces cheese and sells it in the village. Peter also grows potatoes on the family-owned 0.6 hectare land. He sells the harvest to local wholesalers. The family's total average monthly income is 350 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamar has requested credit for starting up a sales business. The family owns an old small truck, which Tamar and Peter will use for the business. With the requested credit, Tamar will purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables from local farmers and take them with the truck to nearby towns for sale. Tamar will sell the products with a price mark-up and get the profit. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family will get more income. Tamar will be able to assist her children financially and improve her family's living conditions. She plans to increase the volume of trade gradually by reinvesting part of the profit into business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy jovial alegre y trabajadora. Está separada de la persona que compartió con ella una relación sentimental por mucho tiempo, fruto de aquella unión tiene tres hijos pequeños por quienes se desvive trabajando para ofrecerles lo mejor. Vive junto a ellos en la casa que obtuvo como herencia de sus padres.

Para su negocio acondicionó un espacio en su casa donde funciona su taller de costura, ella confecciona distintos modelos de vestidos, blusas, pantalones de damas y caballeros, prendas de lencería y trajes para ocasiones especiales. Es muy detallista y eso logra plasmarlo en sus prendas, lo que se puede ver reflejado en la satisfacción que sienten sus clientes. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 15 años, siempre ha trabajado sola. Adicionalmente ha incorporado a sus actividades económicas la venta de bebidas (cerveza y gaseosas), este negocio lo ha establecido hace un año, también en su casa. Ama el trabajo de costura de realiza, inicialmente tenía problemas, ya que no concordaba con el gusto de su público; sin embargo ahora es como asesora de modas y siempre tiene alguna sugerencia para su cliente, con eso maneja muy bien esa situación y siempre logra complacerlos. No obstante y a pesar de hacer lo que le gusta y de las ganancias que recibe por ello, desea también implementar poco a poco su negocio de bebidas, ya que más adelante pretende desarrollar un pequeño bar y consolidar de esa manera otra fuente de ingreso económico por el bien de su familia.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará algunas telas e hilos para seguir trabajando en costura. Así mismo, invertirá parte del dinero en la compra de más cervezas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Tania is 35 years old and she is a very cheerful, happy, and hardworking woman.  She is separated from the person who was her partner for a very long time.  She has three young children from that relationship for whom she works herself to death to be able to give them the best.  She lives with them in the house she inherited from her parents. 

She set up a space in her house for her business that serves as a sewing studio.  She sews different kinds of dresses, blouses, pants for women and for men, lingerie, and suits for special occasions.  She is very detail-oriented and she is able to express this in her garments, which is reflected in her customers' satisfaction.  She has been in this business for almost 15 years and she has always worked alone.  She has also included the sale of drinks (beer and sodas) into her business.  She started this part of her business one year ago, also out of her home.  She loves the sewing work she does, though she had problems initially because she did not make garments to her clientele's taste.  However, now she is like a stylist who always has suggestions for her customers.  This allows her to handle her business well and she is always able to please her customers.  Nevertheless, even though she makes what they like and she makes money from it, she still wants to grow her beverages business little by little as, in the future, she hopes to set up a small bar and thereby solidify another source of income for her family's well-being.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is thankful for the opportunity they are offering her and the confidence they have in her.  She promises to make her payments on time and she is also happy to be a part of her communal bank, as she sees that its members are responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 1,000 nuevos soles to buy some fabrics and thread to keep working in sewing.  She will also invest part of the money in the purchase of more beers and sodas.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and to buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase, 33, is married with five children ages 2 to 13, and he takes care of eight relatives. He sells various goods such as beans, sorghum and maize. Anastase has three years of experience in this work and he currently employs four people to help him. 

Anastase has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various goods such as beans, sorghum and maize for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and also be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as beans, sorghum and maize for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 45 años, es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta. Junto a su pareja tienen tres hijos de 29, 26 y 20 años; de los cuales, los dos mayores ya son independientes y tienen una vida a parte, mientras que el menor aún vive con ella, ya que estudia y depende de los que sus padres le brindan para poder realizar su sueño de llegar a ser profesional.

Su trabajo es la venta de comidas y platos típicos del Perú, trabaja en un local que construyó con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, ahí  ofrece los diferentes platillos que como el “cebiche” o el delicioso “rocoto relleno”. Este trabajo le permite tener solo la mitad de su tiempo ocupado, mientras que la otra mitad del día se dedica a realizar diferentes actividades que requiere en su hogar. Este es un negocio familiar que tiene más de 20 años, pero ella tomó la administración hace aproximadamente 5 años, y cuando empezó tenía muchas dudas y temores, pero con el tiempo y con el apoyo de sus dos trabajadores pudo superarlas y ahora su pequeño restaurante es uno de los mas visitados y concurridos por la clientela de la ciudad. Le está yendo muy bien, está muy feliz, principalmente porque después de muchos años pudo comprar el terreno en el ahora tiene su negocio, ya que antes solo alquilaba el espacio. Desde que trabaja ahí puede aportar en la economía de su hogar y gracias a eso mejoró mucho la situación económica. Para más adelante desea seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio y poder ampliarlo hasta convertirlo en un recreo turístico.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1800) comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir haciendo su trabajo y aumentar la variedad de platos que ofrece a sus clientes, invertirá también en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and she is a very happy, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman.  She has three children with her partner who are 29, 26, and 20 years old.  Of these three, the two eldest are independent and live on their own, while the youngest still lives with her because he is in school and he depends on his parents to be able to realize his dream of becoming a professional.

She works selling typical Peruvian dishes in a space she set up through a lot of effort and work.  There, she offers different dishes, such as ceviche, or the delicious rocoto relleno.  This work only allows her to have half of her time, while she spends the other half of her day taking care of various things that need to be done in her home.  This is a family business that is over 20 years old, but she started managing it about 5 years ago.  When she started, she had many fears and doubts, but with time and the support of her two employees, she was able to get over them and now her small restaurant is one of the most popular and frequented in the city.  It is going very well for her and she is very happy, mostly because she was able buy the land her business is now on after many years of renting the space.  Since she has worked here, she has been able to contribute to her household income and, thanks to that, her financial situation has improved greatly.  She wants to keep growing her business in the future and be able to expand it until it becomes a tourist spot.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is thankful for the opportunity they have given her and the confidence they have in her.  That is why she promises to make her payments on time.  She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because she sees that its members are responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 1,800 nuevos soles to buy ingredients and supplies to keep doing her job and to increase the variety of dishes she offers her customers.  She will also invest in the purchase of beers and sodas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients she needs to make ceviche

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abadacogora Group

texts.en: Colette is a leader for the group called “Abadacogora” in Kinyarwanda, which in English means “no rest, work hard.” She is 45 years old, married, and has eight children who all go to school. Collete, as a leader in the group, sells bananas and has spent three years in the business. Her group mates also sell different items. Since they jointly came together they say the loan will help them to boost their businesses. With the loan, Colette plans to buy more bananas to sell while the profits from the business will help her build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is composed of four hard-working women. Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of  700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Annet generate greater profits to pay school fees for her children. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Annet's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 56 years old. She lives in a small village of Tetritskaro District with her family, husband Akaki and two sons (20 and 28 years old). The younger son is a contractor for a military service and gets a salary. The older son works at the Security Police and gets a salary as well. Nanuli and her husband are busy with agricultural activities. They have 2 milking cows and some chickens. Nanuli produces cheese every day and sells on the local open market. Also, she sells chickens in nearby villages. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari.

Nanuli requested a loan for purchasing calves. She plans to raise the calves and later sell them at a profit. She will reinvest the additional earnings to expand the family agricultural business to make it more profitable, thereby improving their living conditions.  




.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as bananas, lotions, soap, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Azimjoni

texts.ru: Азимчони добрый и активный молодой парень. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Более 3-х лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Раньше торговал в ларьке и постепенно расширяя бизнес открыл магазин. В кишлаке он арендовал магазин, его основными покупателями являются жители данного кишлака. У Азимчона всегда свежие продукты поэтому у него много покупателей.  Азимчони хотел бы получить займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью попонения оборотного капитала и обновления товарооборота.
texts.en: Azimjoni is a kind and active young man. He is single and lives with his parents. Azimjoni has been selling food for over 3 years. He started his business with a small stall, but gradually expanded his operation and now runs a grocery store. He uses a rented building in a village, whose inhabitants are his main customers. They are drawn to the store because Azimjoni always stocks fresh products. Azimjoni would like to obtain a loan to purchase food products, as well as increase his working capital and merchandise turnover.

loans.use: to stock up on food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his barber shop by buying more machines and other materials.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 49 years old and lives in a small village of Gardabani District with her husband, Nodar. Nodar uses his own car and offers taxi service to the local population and gets service fees. Lali is busy with an agricultural business. She has two milking cows and produces yogurt which she sells in Tbilisi (Capital of Georgia) and on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family 600 Lari.

Lali requested a loan to rent a little building in her village and open a grocery store and also to purchase stock for the store.This will increase the income of the family. With increased income she will be able to reinvest in the family business to expand it to make it more profitable. The living conditions of Lali and her husband will improve.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the store.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 56 years old. She lives in a small village in Tetritskaro District with her family, husband Geront, her 33-year-old daughter, her son-in-law and grandchild. Her daughter works in a confectionery store and bakes cakes. Nanuli, with her husband and son-in-law, runs an agricultural business. In particular, they are busy with cattle breeding. They have 6 cows, 11 calves, 6 pigs, 30 hens, and 70 sheep. They are very hard working people and take good care of their livestock. Leila produces dairy food, mainly cheese and curds, and sells them in Tbilisi (Capital of Georgia). Geront sells calves, piglets and lambs in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari.

Leila requested a credit for expansion of the cattle shed. After the building is expanded, the family will be able to keep more livestock there. This will enable them to double production and sales of dairy food and the income of the family will significantly increase. With an increased amount of profit, they will be able to repair the house because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is age 50. She has six children who all go to school. She sells sorghum. She has been in this business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy sorghum to increase the volume of her store. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is 27 years old. She has two children aged between one and seven. Only the oldest goes to school. Scovia sells foodstuffs. With the loan she wants to buy more foodstuffs, sodas, and alcohol drinks from the local brewery. The profits from the business will be for building a business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Alex A.'s Group

texts.en: These are teachers of a primary school in Kalangba, a village in northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have applied for a loan of 14,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. This will be the first loan this group of teachers will be accessing from Kiva lenders. School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf. Alex is a head teacher at the school and leader of this group. He is 40 years old and married to a teacher, and the couple has three children who are attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Alex has been a teacher for 10 years. He will use his share of this loan to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 39 years old and married with three children aged between 3 and 11 years old. He also takes care of 6 relatives. He sells clothes and shoes for women. Gratien has seven years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Gratien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more shoes and clothes for women for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for women for resale.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of three hard working women. Rose is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her farming, which sells fresh food like matooke, sweet potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds for planting food, and will help Rose to generate greater profits to be used for her medical expenses. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for planting food.

loans.name: Sorie I.'s Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present this group of teachers from Makeni. Like their counterparts in other regions of Sierra Leone, these borrowers are going to use this loan for different purposes. At the end of each month, they will repay their share of the loan from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the money from their pay and then repaying SMT/Kiva on their behalf. Sorie I. is the leader of the group. Born about 58 years ago in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone, Sorie is married and the father of 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Sorie has been a professional teacher for 39 years now. He has requested this loan to buy home-building materials – iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. -- for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy home-building materials – iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. -- for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR FELIX MAS QUE PREOCUPARSE POR SU FAMILIA ES UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR EL TRABAJA LOS 7 DIAS DE LA SEMANA SU TURNO COMPLETO.
FELIX SIEMPRE VE POR LA MEJORA DE SUS HIJOS YA QUE LA ESPOSA LOS ABANDONO Y EL TIENE QE TRABAJAR MUCHO PARA QUE NO LE FALTE NADA A ELLOS. EL PROYECTO ES TERMINAR DE COMPRAR UN TERRENO  Y EMPEZAR A CONSTRUIR UN PATRIMONIO EL CUAL HEREDAR A SUS HIJOS EN UN FUTURO.
ESPERA QUE LO PODAMOS AYUDAR ES POR ESO QUE ACUDIO A NOSOTROS.
texts.en:
Felix doesn't just take care of his family.  He is a hard-working man who works seven days a week, full time.

Felix is always looking out for his children as his wife abandoned them and he has to work hard so that they don't want for anything.  His project is to finish buying a plot of land and start building an estate that he can leave his children as a future inheritance.

Felix hopes that we can help him.  This is why he came to us.

loans.use: To pay for a plot of land in order to build it up for his family

loans.name: Tepatasi

texts.en: Tepatasi is 26 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To get her business started, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking powder, dripping oil, and a new frying pan.  Tepatasi hopes to expand her business in the future. She joined SPBD, a Kiva partner, in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, dripping oil, and a new frying pan to start a pancake business

loans.name: Galdina

texts.es:
La señora Galdina y su eposo viven solos, sus hijos ya hicieron sus vidas de casados. Ella es dueña del negocio de transporte de mercancia desde hace ya diez años, invirtio y compro un trailer el cual maneja su esposo, con el servicio que ella presta solventan sus gastos a la perfección. El trailer es un medio de transporte que necesita de mucho mantenimiento y ella le piensa comprar neumaticos nuevos y mantenimiento general. 
Ella quiere proteger a su esposo en carretera y estar tranquila sabiendo que el transporte le brinda seguridad en cuanto fallas mecanicas y asi poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Galdina and her husband live alone; their children already have their married lives.  She has been the owner of a merchandise transport company for 10 years. Galdina invested in her business by buying her husband a trailer. She has always resolved her debts perfectly and quickly.  The new trailer is used for their business and needs new tires and general maintenance.

She wants to protect her husband on the highway and have the peace of mind of knowing that his means of transportation is safe with regard to mechanical failures and therefore be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for general maintenance.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo  es una persona  trabajadora   que  día con día  se esfuerza  por   sacar adelante a  su  familia  ya  que  es lo mas importante  en  su  vida, el se  dedica a la venta  de  comida  rápida  como  hamburguesas y hot  dogs, en  este  momento  requiere realizar la  compra  de  materia prima  para  poder  seguir trabajando, esta  muy  contento  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  gracias  al  apoyo  brindado  podrá  seguir  ofreciendo a  sus clientes el excelente  servicio  que  lo  a caracterizado  además  de   que hará  crecer  su   negocio  obteniendo  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Gerardo is a hardworking person who struggles day by day to provide for his family, which is the most important thing in his life. He works selling fast food, such as hamburgers and hot dogs. He currently needs to purchase raw materials in order to continue working. He is very happy to have found us because thanks to the support offered he will be able to continue offering his customers the excellent service for which he is known, and this will expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his food stall.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa María es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace 3 años Tiene su negocio que es la compra y venta de calzado pues siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Rosa María es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante para ella la disciplina es el mejor secreto en el trabajo, porque le permite realizar sus metas en el futuro, ella solicita financiamiento para compra y venta de zapatos, de cuero y deportivos para niños y adultos.
texts.en: Rosa María has been an entrepreneur for three years. She buys and sells shoes and prides herself in offering shoppers excellent customer service. Rosa María is a hardworking woman who hopes to improve her life through her work. For her, discipline is the secret to success, because it allows her to achieve her goals for her future. She is requesting a loan to buy athletic and leather shoes for both children and adults.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: El Mirador De Cconchaccalla Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “El Mirador de Cconchaccalla” en la comunidad de Cconchaccalla del distrito de San Jeronimo de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas principal de los socios son la agricultura y ganadería, otros se dedican a la venta de comestibles,   a la venta de verduras, a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y otros más.   

(La señora Nancy está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Nancy  nació en la comunidad de Cconchaccalla y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la Nancy es la venta de comestibles pero también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde atiende todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche o hasta que se agote el pan. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nancy requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas más.
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the community bank "El Mirador de Cconchaccalla" in the Cconchaccalla community of the district of San Jeronimo in the province and department of Cusco. This community bank is made up of people looking for every opportunity to succeed and through their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. The main economic activities of the partners are agriculture and livestock, others are engaged in selling food, the sale of vegetables, and the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and more.

(Mrs. Nancy is raising her hand in the photograph). The member Nancy was born in the community of Cconchaccalla and lives in the same community where she was born.  She is 30 years old and has a common law relationship from which she has three children. Her main economic activity is selling food but she is also dedicated to agriculture and small animal husbandry.  She has a small shop in her home where every day she works from 5 am to 9 at night or until the bread runs out. She has been dedicated to this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. At this time Nancy needs a loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, milk and other things.

The group members as a whole appreciate the opportunity offered and agree to comply with the payment of their various fees within the prescribed period.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It is characterized as a tourist area for its archaeological sites through the historic center as well as for its landscapes and history, being a lovely city of the Southern Region of the country. Cusco is known as a popular tourist area, a commercial zone, and a city that celebrates the traditional festival of Inti Raymi.  It also offers one of the seven wonders of the world -- "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, milk and other things.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
