In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha is 58 years of age. She is still very active and supports her husband in his dairy business. She has given birth to two sons and three daughters. Her elder son works while two of her remaining children are getting their education. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s dairy business.

With the loan investment he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity and improve his sales and income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Martha is confident that the loan will help him make his business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Joesim

texts.en:
Joesim is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a electronics repair shop in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her electronics repair shop.

Joesim has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Joesim has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make more buns and tea to sell.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer de 57 años, está casada hace 11 años con Antero y fruto de su amor tienen tres hijos que ya son adultos. Actualmente vive en su casa propia, la que pudo comprar con el paso de los años, luego de ahorrar a diario. Vive al lado de su familia completa, juntos luchan día a día para lograr el éxito económico que persiguen y poder realizar sus sueños.

Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida y platos típicos de su región (asados de carne y plátanos). Todos los días, a tempranas horas de la mañana, se dirige al mercado de la ciudad para realizar la compra de todos los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de las comidas que vende en la vereda de su casa desde las 4 de la tarde. Acondiciona su cocina a fuego lento en el que realiza los asados de carne, también coloca dos mesas; en una exhibe todos los platillos y en la otra coloca 4 sillas para sus comensales. Su excelente sazón ha hecho que su puesto de comida sea una parada necesaria para satisfacer el hambre de sus clientes. Viene realizando este trabajo alrededor de 4 años y desde que empezó ha recibido la ayuda y el apoyo constante de su hija, ambas trabajan sin cesar. Por otro lado, de manera eventual, también vende ropa en los pueblos alejados de la ciudad, en esto lleva 8 meses. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo en su casa, no tiene necesidad de salir a otro lugar para vender, le agrada generar sus propios ingresos económicos trabajando en lo que más le gusta hacer que es cocinar. Para más adelante espera poder instalar un restaurante y atender mejor a su clientela.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella una vez más. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500) comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para continuar con su negocio. También adquirirá algunas prendas para su otro negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 57-year-old woman who has been married to Antero for 11 years. They have three adult children. She currently lives in a home that she purchased after many years of setting aside daily savings. Zoila lives with her entire family and together they strive each day to achieve financial success and the fulfillment of their dreams.

Her business involves selling fast food and traditional dishes of the region (such as roasted meats and plantains). Every day, in the early hours of the morning, she heads out to the market in the city in order to buy all of the ingredients that she needs for preparing her dishes, which are sold from the sidewalk in front of her house beginning at 4pm. Her kitchen is equipped with a slow-burning fire pit for roasting the meat. She also has two tables set up, one for displaying all of her dishes and the other with four chairs for seating her guests. The exceptional flavor of her dishes makes her food stand a necessary stop for customers who want to satisfy their hunger. Zoila has been in this line of work for four years and has had the help and constant support of her daughter from the very beginning. Both of them work nonstop. On an occasional basis, Zoila also sells clothing in the remote areas of the city. She has been doing this for eight months. What she enjoys about her job is being able to stay at home since she does not have to travel to another place to generate sales. She appreciates being able to generate her own income by doing something that she enjoys, which is cooking. Going forward, she hopes to establish a restaurant where she can better serve her customers.

This is her 11th loan with MFP. Zoila is grateful for this opportunity and the trust that has been demonstrated to her once again. She promises to complete her payments on time and appreciates being part of her Communal Bank, where all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. The loan amount of 2,500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy the necessary ingredients for continuing her business. She will also buy a few articles of clothing for her other business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business and a few articles for her clothing business.

loans.name: C 2625 Abateranankunga Group

texts.en:
Josiane is 43 years old and is married with five children aged between 3 and 14 years old. She also takes care of one relative who is 18 years old. She sells various goods such as sugar, biscuits, lotions, soap, etc. Josiane is a leader of this group, which is called "C 2625 ABATERANANKUNGA" in the local language. 

In the photo, she's the first person from the right side. She works from 7 a.m to 5 p.m daily except on Sunday. Josiane has 10 years of experience in this work and she currently employs one person to help her.

Josiane has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various foods such as beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy various foods such as beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Jeannethe

texts.es: Jeannethe de 47 años de edad, casada, con 20 años de experiencia tiene por actividad, el servicio de garaje a los diferentes vehiculos,  que ofrece a los poblacion de su localidad, el financiamiento lo quiere para mejorar las condiciones de seguridad de dicho local como: contruir un porton de hierro con mejores condiciones, y contruir una tapia en el fondo del local, con el financiamiento comprara material de construccion como: cementro, arena, hierro, zinc, perlines, clavos, alambre entre otros.
texts.en:
Jeannethe is 47 years old and married. She has 20 years of experience in providing a garage service for housing different vehicles. This service is offered to the residents of her town.

The loan she is requesting will be used to improve the security conditions at this location. She will install an iron gate that is in better condition and build a wall in front of the facility. The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, zinc, crossbeams, nails, wire, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for making improvements to her parking facility.

loans.name: Jean Bodin

texts.fr:
Jean Bodin est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 34 ans, marié et père d'un enfant de deux ans. il est Propriétaire d'une alimentation depuis 03 ans dans un quartier de la place où il vend des produits de première nécessité.
Avec ce crédit, il voudrait acheter des boites de conserves, du riz, des boissons hygiéniques, du pain dans l'optique d'agrandir son stock et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle toujours grandissante. Avec les bénéfices supplémentaires  générés, il a pour ambition d'agrandir son activité, de mieux subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Bodin is a young man from Cameroon. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of a 2-year-old child. 

For the past three years, he has been the owner of a local grocery store where he sells staples. 

He plans to use this loan to buy canned goods, rice, beverages, toilet paper and bread to increase his stock and meet the needs of a growing customer base. 

He will use his profits to expand his business and better provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: to stock up on staples for his grocery store.

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
Phork is an industrious woman who devotes herself to rice farming to provide her seven children with good opportunities of education. She is 55 years old and has seven children, residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. At this time, some of her children are already married and have their own families. Only two children are still in need of her support for their university degree. For additional income, Phork operates a small store in her village and serves a kind of Khmer food between lunch time and dinner to local people.

In order to help her children achieve success in life, Phork would like to take out a loan in the sum of USD 700, to pay for university fees. She said that she wants to see all of her children have a good education and a better life in store for them. She hopes to receive the loan from kind lenders to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap and beverages

loans.name: Abdulkarim

texts.en:
Abdulkarim is 30 years old and is married with one child who is 8 years old. He sells bananas and he has 5 years of experience in this business. 

Abdulkarim has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate bananas for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To cultivate bananas for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide for his vegetables

loans.name: Concepcion Del Rosario

texts.es: Concepcion del Rosario de 37 años de edad tiene por actividad economica la una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, herramienta que surgio por la necesidad de tener un medio de ingresos de economicos   para su familia, en el cual tiene 13 años de experiencia, ya ha tenido credito con fundacion leon 2000 y ha demostrado responsabilidad, trabajadora, buena paga, y gracias al apoyo y la confianza que fundacion le ha brindado con los financaimiento ha podido invertir en capital de trabajo y de dicha forma surtir su pulperia, en esta ocacion esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para comprar productos de consumo diario como : arroz, azucar, café, pan, leche, huevos, frijoles, tiste, chicha, crema, condimentos, verduras, galletas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Concepcion del Rosario is 37 years old.  She has a general store located in her home.  This tool emerged from the need to have a way of getting income for her family, and she has 13 years of experience in her business.

She has had a loan with the Fundación Leon 2000, and she has demonstrated responsibility, hard-work, and good repayment.  Thanks to the support and the trust the Fundación has given her through the loan, she has been able to invest in working capital and stock her general store.  

This time she is requesting loan to buy products that are consumed daily like rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, beans, “tiste” [a traditional drink], “chicha” [a corn based drink], cream, condiments, vegetables, and cookies, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, beans, “tiste” [a traditional drink], “chicha” [a corn based drink], cream, condiments, vegetables, and cookies, among others.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Dewa Ayu and the Sinar Rejeki group are taking out a new loan in the same loan amount. Each member gets 1M IDR and plans to use it to buy two piglets for 800,000 IDR and the rest for feed.

Dewa Ayu hopes MUK and KIVA will continue to support them so that they can succeed and their families can become prosperous.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and  shampoo, dyes, and nail polish, to restock her shop. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of products, such as new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, shampoo, dyes, and nail polish, to restock her shop

loans.name: Phi

texts.en: Phi is requesting a new loan to buy umbrellas and canvas awnings for her food stall in order to protect her customers from both the sunshine and the rain. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy umbrellas and canvas awnings for her food stall

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni tiene 23 años, vive con esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes brinda amor y una buena educación. 
Junto a su pareja tienen un restaurante desde hace 2 años, les va bien, sobre todo en las noches, ya que vende los ricos pollos a la brasa; además cuentan con el apoyo de una persona que les ayuda con la atención a los clientes. Este negocio les es rentable porque es el único restaurante de su comunidad. Sus planes a futuro son implementar más mesas, sillas y un estante para colocar sus bebidas.

Ella es parte de un banco comunal de MFP, donde se siente muy a gusto porque aprende cosas nuevas sobre la mejora de su negocio. Además está muy agradecida con las personas que hacer posible que ella acceda a este crédito, el cual será de gran beneficio para su familia.

Con este dinero comprará los ingredientes que necesita para preparación de los exquisitos platos que ofrece en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Yeni is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She loves her children and provides them a good education.

Yeni and her partner have managed a restaurant for two years. Their business is doing well, especially at night since they serve delicious roasted chicken. They also have the help of one employee who attends to the customers. This business is profitable because it is the only restaurant in their community. Her plans for the future include furnishing her establishment with more tables, chairs, and a bar for setting out beverages.

Yeni is a member of a Communal Bank with MFP, which she enjoys because she has learned new things that will help to improve her business. In addition, she is grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan, which will be a great benefit for her family. The money will be used to buy the ingredients that she needs for preparing the delicious dishes offered in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Sandra Mireya

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer que tiene 24 años, se caracteriza por ser una persona alegre, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Sandra tiene un hijo de 3 años y está embarazada, viven en Urcuquí que se encuentra a media hora de la ciudad de Ibarra.

Sandra trabaja sola en la crianza de animales como pollos y cerdos, el crédito que solicita a Fodemi es para la compra de pollos, cerdos para incrementar su negocio y en la mejora de los galpones y chancheras, inversión que le beneficará en sus ingresos debido a que tendrá mas espacio para sus animales. 

Sandra sueña con darles lo mejor a sus hijos trabajando y teniendo una familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 24 year old woman who is known for being a happy and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead.  Sandra has a three year old son, and she is pregnant.  They live in Urcuquí, which is a half an hour from the city of Ibarra.

Sandra works alone raising animals like chickens and pigs.  The loan that she is requesting from Fodemi is to buy chickens and pigs in order to increase her business.  The loan is also to improve the animal sheds and pig pens.  This investment will be beneficial to her income because she will have more space for her animals.

Sandra dreams of giving her children the best, working, and having her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs in order to increase her business and to improve the animal sheds and pig pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her eggplant

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Chom, 31, lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province with her husband and four school-aged children. She is in the rice farming business, selling fresh fish and at the same time fattening hogs to sell for additional income. She has been doing this for almost 12 years. 

Chom would like to make improvements in her fish-selling business, and therefore she is asking for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase a boat with a motor for her husband, which he will use for fishing. These will help Chom increase the amount of fish she can sell from her rented booth, thus make more income to provide the family’s living needs. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and offers further education to all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a boat with a motor for fishing business.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est marié å un/e couturière et a 08 enfants dont 06 scolarisés.
Komi est revendeur d’argile verte depuis 1992. Il exerce seul l’activité dans un magasin et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter de l’argile verte.
Komi veut subvenir aux besoins de la famille avec le bénéfice réalisé.
texts.en:
Komi, age 47, is married to a seamstress. The couple have 8 children, 6 of whom go to school.  

Komi has been selling green clay since 1992. He works alone out of a shop. He is seeking this first loan from WAGES to purchase green clay. 

Komi will use his profits to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy green clay for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old. He is married to Joyce and together they have two children, who are twins. He operates a grocery store and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his first loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale in his grocery.

He hopes to prosper in his business and be self-reliant.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale in his grocery.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Patricia is married and blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and six years. She keeps poultry, a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She wants to purchase more chicks for rearing and has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. The profit she makes will aid her to pay her children’s school fees. She hopes to see her business expand.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old. She is married to Paul and together they have five school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES. 5,000 from the business. She was introduced to KADET by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase farm inputs to use on her farm like fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides.She will use anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Betty hopes to rent more farming land so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Sarah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods like 'matooke' (green bananas) for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy more fresh foods for cooking. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sarah's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money and how to budget.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like 'matooke' (green bananas) for resale.

loans.name: San Javier De Sanca Jahuira Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “SAN JAVIER DE SANCA JAHUIRA” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por trece integrantes donde la señora Yola es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescados, venta de chamarras, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, transportista. 
La señora Yola cuenta que es hace medio año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por la promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta los ahorros.
En la fotografía se encuentra una socia escondida y solo se puede ver una parte de su cabeza, ella es la señora Heidy que le dio temor la cámara pero no quería separse del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San Javier de Sanca Jahuira" is starting its second loan cycle as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of 13 members and is led by Sra. Yola as its president. The members have developed business activities that include selling fish, selling jackets, selling vegetables, managing a neighborhood store, and providing transportation.

Sra. Yola joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer six months ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter. She currently manages a neighborhood store and has been in this line of work for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying sugar, rice, and oil. These items will be purchased at the traditional fairs in El Alto and later sold at her retail shop. Working in this manner helps her family get ahead. Yola is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Yola said that she enjoys the savings. In the photo, there is one member who is hidden and only part of her head can be seen. This member is Sra. Haidy, who is fearful of the camera, but she did not want to be separated from the group.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria nació en la ciudad de Lares (Lares se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco.). Ella tiene 55 años edad, vive en la ciudad de Calca, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La Señora Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Ella tiene un puesto de venta alquilado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad Calca. Ella trabaja desde las 5h30 hasta las 17h30 todos los días de la semana. Ya son 30 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería así poder surtir y abastecer el puesto de venta. Ella comprará sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y tarros de leche. María es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the town of Lares, which is two hours from the city of Cusco, in Cusco department. She is 55, and lives in the town of Calca. She is married, and has three children. 

Calca is noted for having beautiful scenery, and for being a tourist, livestock-raising and farming area. She belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

Maria sells foodstuffs and has a rented stand in one of the markets in the town of Calca.

She works from 5:30am to 5:30pm every day of the week. She has been doing this work for 30 years now, and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion, she is accessing the loan in order to buy merchandise for supplying and stocking her stand. She will buy sacks of rice and sugar, as well as noodles and cans of milk

María is a very determined woman, and her dream is to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and cans of milk.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Couturière de profession depuis 2006, Madame Amélévi est âgée de 33ans. Elle exerce l’activité à domicile. En plus de cette activité elle vend des produits de mercerie et des pagnes pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes et des produits de mercerie. Elle veut renforcer son activité, se prendre en charge et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en:
Amélévi, age 33, has been a seamstress since 2006. She works out of her home. 

In addition to her profession, she also sells sewing notions and pagnes (colorful cloth) to better meet customer demand. 

She is seeking this first loan to buy pagnes and sewing notions for resale. She wants to strengthen her activity, support herself, and eventually get married.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and sewing notions for resale.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina is a woman who helps her fellow citizens. She likes to help people who need it. Nigina has been working at dressmaking for more than 6 years. She is a better dressmaker than other dressmakers because she has  ideas which others don't have. Nigina is a woman of fashion and good taste and that’s why she has the best quality  dresses. She is married and has two children. Her family loves Nigina very much. 

Nigina concentrates on doing the best for her family. She wants to make dresses with new fashions for her fellow citizens. She asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine to develop  her business. Nigina is awaiting your help.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Juliet operates a bridal gown retailing business. What she basically does is buy bridal gowns from her suppliers and sell them per item with a profit. Her products are bridal gowns and dresses. Her regular customers are people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juliet hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional bridal gowns and other merchandise  needed in her business

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla petrona con 47 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad , de la localidad de leon tiene por actividad economica la  venta de meracaderia en general actividad en la cual se desempeña desde hace 11 años, la cual inicio para tener una herramienta de trabajo e ingresos para el apoyo economico de su hijos y familia. En la actualidad pabla ha cumplido con sus  metas y objectivos como el de ser independiente economicamente y en lo material tener una casa propia, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar mercaderia  como:  blusas, zapatos, toalla se baño, ropa interior, pantalones de hombre y mujer, perfumeria, juegos de sabanas, entre otros
texts.en:
Pabla Petrona is 47 and single. She has one minor child and is from the city of León. She has a business selling general merchandise, and has been engaged in this work for 11 years. She started it in order to have a means of work and income to support her family.

Now Pabla has met her goals and objectives, such as that of being financially independent, and in material terms, of having her own house. She wants the loan in order to buy merchandise such as blouses, shoes, bath towels, underwear, men's and women's pants, perfumes, sets of sheets, and other products.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shoes, bath towels, underwear, men's and women's pants, perfumes, sets of sheets, and other products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old. She is married to Kenneth. She supports her three children aged between three and ten years. Her husband contributes additional income to the family.

She has been selling a variety of cereals for one year and derives a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to buy cereals like rice, cow peas, and beans. The anticipated profits will be used to build a house.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more plots of land and develop them.

loans.use: to buy cereals like rice, cow peas, and beans.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is thirty-three years old and a humble farmer who has been in the rice farming business for almost ten years. She cultivates rice both for her daily sustenance and for sale. She is married to her husband who is involved in construction business. Together, they have three children attending school. They are living together in in Baray district of Kompong Tom province.

So wants to develop her business and upgrade her living conditions, which is why she is taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production. So believes that this loan will enable her to attain a success in her business and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan investment she will buy clothes in bulk quantity that will allow her offer more variety of clothes to her clients and increase her sales and profits. She is a very hardworking and confident lady and very much sure about her business success after investing the loan.

Note: In the picture the lady raising her hand is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes selling business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 45 years old  and single. She supports a family of ten. She was blessed with four children aged between 13 and 23. Justina runs a business of buying and selling green tea leaves and has been in operation for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is servicing her third loan of KES 10,000 with KADET Ltd., after successfully repaying her previous loans. She intends to use the loan to purchase green tea leaves for resale. 

The profits will be used to pay her kids' school fees. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale tea farming and to be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a widow and has four children. She sells shea butter at Eguafo near Elmina which she has done for some time now. As a single parent she uses her income for the general upkeep of her family. Maame needs this loan to purchase large quantities of shea butter for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of shea butter for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a fruit vendor. She sells oranges at Eguafo near Elmina which she has done for four years now. Esi is married with four children. She uses her income to help her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Esi will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit to better meet her customers' demand. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fruit

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old. She is single but has a child. She supports two of her siblings. She knits tablecloths and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 7,000 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase knitting material. She  will use the profits she gets to plough back into the business.

She hopes to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase knitting materials

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
This is Luisa. She previously availed herself of a PHP 17,000 loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Luisa dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies at the meetings.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment he will buy groceries like salt, spices, sugar etc. in bulk quantity that will allow him to fulfill client orders on time and increase his profits.

Shahida is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has got great skills and receives regular orders every month. She has given birth to four daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education. She is very positive in her thinking and confident about her husband’s business success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso has been busy with an agriculture business for more than five years. She works hard to develop her business and to find money to feed and keep her children because she is widow and brings up her children alone. Her children are proud of their mother and help Tojiniso in her business. 

Tojiniso works keeping livestock. She loves animals very much and that’s why she choose this kind of business. She takes care of cows and sheep for a few months and than she sells them to the local people. Tojiniso is asking for a loan to buy livestock to expand her business. She is waiting for your help.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a single parent and has four children.  Efua produces fanti kenkey (a type of dumpling) for sale. In the picture are the leaves she uses to cover the maize dough in the kenkey preparation.  

Efua has been in this business for 20 years now. Efua will use her loan to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey for sale. With the new profit from the expanded business, Efua wishes to produce kenkey in large quantities to distribute to a retailer.

loans.use: to purchase maize in large quantities to enable her to produce more kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old. She is married to Enoch and blessed with eight children aged between 15 and 33. She owns a posho mill, a business she started eight months ago and earns her a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bags of maize for sale. The profit she earns from it will help her build rental houses which is also her dream.

loans.use: To purchase maize for sale in her posho mill.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 61 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is a widower with five children. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Christopher will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate the last-born child. His hopes and dreams are to export the farm products and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en:
Ulziisaihan, 39, lives with her husband and her two children in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her older son is a secondary school student and the younger daughter is a kindergarten student. Her son will soon go to college. 

She started her organic dairy product production business in 2000. Her husband helps with her business. She is well known to the locals and has many regular customers and suppliers. She makes delicious and quality products. She buys milk from herders at whole sale price and delivers her milk in her Russian car. She wants to expand her organic dairy production business which is why she wants to purchase some equipment to produce new products. 

She is a very hardworking and talented women. She says "I dream to create my own brand with organic dairy products by expanding my business." She is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase the equipment to produce new organic dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase the equipment to produce new organic dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy space for his music business.

loans.name: Badieye

texts.fr: Badièye est un homme marié. Il est père de cinq enfants.Il a ouvert depuis trois ans, une filiale représentante d'une société d'assurance dans sa localité.Il parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de  sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins. Afin d'acheter des talons d'assurances, il sollicite un pret de 400000f.
texts.en:
Badièye is a married father of five children. 

For the past three years, he has been running the local branch of an insurance company. The income earned allows him to provide for himself and for his family. 

He is seeking a loan of 400,000F to buy insurance stubs.

loans.use: to buy insurance stubs.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Chean is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He works as a rice cultivator helping his mother in managing the business. In addition, he has recently started working for a restaurant in Phnom Penh and gives his monthly payment as a contribution to the family's income. 

Chean wants to see his family increasing its income and help his mother earn more income. So he is taking out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a piece of farmland to expand his farming business. Someday, he hopes to make his business more profitable and lift the family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland to expand his farming business.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is the only person feeding and keeping her family. She is married and has four children. Shahlo works hard from early morning till late evening to find money. For some years now, Shahlo has been busy with her own business. She sells curtains and another things for the house. Shahlo knows her business perfectly. She tries to do the best for her children. Her children love Shahlo and are proud of her because she is the best mother. Shahlo wants to widen her assortment and that’s why she is asking for a loan to buy goods. She is waiting for your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season.

loans.name: Mary  Moige

texts.en:
Mary has increased her profits from 10,000 to 13,000 Kenyan shillings. Through the loan, she wants to increase her business portfolio by buying cereals for milling and additional cow. The anticipated profits will be used in the expansion of her business and also to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd. and the precious two loans have been successfully paid back. Her dream for her future business is to buy more cattle for dairy farming and to buy a large quantity of maize and store it to sell in a period of scarcity.

loans.use: To buy chicken and animal feed and sacks of maize to grind.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 46 years old and a responsible mother of five children, three of whom are single. She resides with her husband and some of her children in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Fishing and selling fish are the main business activities for Sam to generate income for her family. Her husband is supportive and helpful in managing the family-owned businesses and supporting their children’s education.

Sam wants to fix and renovate her house so she decided to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase timber for the construction. She hopes to provide her children with basic necessities and a comfortable living and also hopes to lift her family out of poverty some day.

loans.use: to purchase timber for her house construction.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 42 años, se considera una persona luchadora, responsable y sobre todo emprendedora. María vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Urcuquí que se encuentra a media hora de Ibarra.

María trabaja con sus hijos en la agricultura ellos siembran Maiz, fréjol y arbeja, al momento estan cocechando lo ultimo que les quedó del último sembrío, María solicita un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de semillas de Maiz, fréjol, arbeja y para abonos, fungicidas, plaguicidas para que su producción sea de calidad y pueda obtener buenos ingresos y estabilidad.

María sueña en tener buena salud para seguir trabajando por sus hijos y que ellos sean un día profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is a hard-working person, responsible and, above all, enterprising.  She lives with her husband and their children in Urcuqui, about an half-hour from Ibarra. 

María is a farmer.  She and her children work her land, growing maize, beans and peas.  She's now harvesting the last of what's left from her last crop.  Maria is applying for a Fodemi loan that she will use to buy seeds--maize, beans, peas--and other supplies--fertilizer, fungicides, insecticides--for her next planting.

Maria hopes for good health and professional careers for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Santos Isidoro

texts.es: Santos isidoro cadado, con  52 años de edad con  5 hijos dependiente  tiene por actividad economica un pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion con la cual cuenta con  21 años de expericiencia, hasta el dia de hoy ese ha sido su medio de vida, el que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo diciplina, entrega, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para la compra de consumo diario como: productos de aseo personal pasta dental, desodorantes, sepillo de dientes, jabon de baños, y azucar, arroz, frijoles, pana leche huevos entre otros.
texts.en:
Santos Isidoro, 52, is married with five children.  He has a grocery store, which is located in his home.  He has 21 years of experience in this business.  To this day he has made his living this way.  He has made progress in this business thanks to great deal of effort and discipline.

The loan he is seeking will be for the purchase of items such as toothpaste, toothbrushes, deodorant and soap, as well groceries such as sugar, rice, beans,milk, bread and eggs.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products such as toothpaste, toothbrushes, deodorant and soap, as well as groceries such as sugar, rice, beans,milk, bread and eggs.

loans.name: Heliodoro Jose

texts.es: Heliodoro Jose cadado, con  58 años de edad con hijos mayores de edad tiene por actividad economica un pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion con la cual cuenta con  20 años de expericiencia, hasta el dia de hoy ese ha sido su medio de vida, el que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo diciplina, entrega, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para la compra de consumo diario como: productos de aseo personal pasta dental, desodorantes, sepillo de dientes, jabon de baños, y azucar, arroz, frijoles, pana leche huevos entre otros.
texts.en: Heliodoro Jose is 58 years old.  He is married and has children who are now adults.  His business is a grocery store which is located in his home.  He has 20 years experience.  This business has been his way of life and he has managed to make progress in it with a lot of effort, discipline and commitment.  He would like this loan to buy basic products such as toiletries (toothpaste, deodorants, toothbrushes and soap) and also sugar, rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, deodorants, toothbrushes and soap, plus sugar, rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a humble man, who lives in Mwambalazi. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. He is located near the market where little by little he has gained clients' trust and affection. With this business Daniel is able to sustain his extended family and he has high expectations of growing this business since he works hard every day. Today his main clients are neighbors and passersby. However he wants to have more opportunities. 

His investment plan consists of diversifying his merchandise, adding more products requested by clients such as cooking fat oil, maize flour, cereals and rice, etc. This will improve his working conditions and amplify his product selection according to clients' demand. This is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand his business. He believes he can succeed due to the high demand, his strength in his performance, and work discipline. All of these qualities will help his business grow.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat oil, maize flour, cereals and rice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 72 years old, married to Susa,n and blessed with two children aged 18 and 14. He sells livestock, a business he ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cattle, sheep and goats to sell. His profits will help him pay his children’s school fees and purchase more livestock. 

His dream is to purchase a piece of land and build his own house as well as educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase cattle, sheep and goats to sell.

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en:
Hourn is 38 years of age and she continuously operates a rice farming business as a source of income. Besides farming, she makes and sells a kind of cake in a small village for additional income. These two businesses enable her to cover her daily expenses. She has been involved in these businesses for over 10 years earning USD 2.50 per day on average. She is married yet she doesn’t have any children. She wishes to have one soon. 

Hourn would like to acquire additional capital to the amount of KHR 1,500,000 to purchase an extra plot of farmland. This will help develop her business as well as her standard of living. She hopes that this time, she will be able to enlarge her profit for the welfare of family.

loans.use: to purchase an extra plot of farmland.

loans.name: Fuzayl

texts.en: Fuzayl wants to provide his family with all the things they need. He does his best to achieve this. He has two lovely children and a kind wife. Fuzayl also is very good friend and the best business man. For some years now he has had his own business. He is busy selling food products. In the local market he has own selling place. His goods have many consumers. His skills help to him to be successful in business. Fuzayl’s aim is to buy goods to develop his business. He is waiting for your help.

loans.use: To buy goods to develop his business.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim has been engaged in agriculture for more than 30 years. The main scope of his business is meat selling, but he also grows tomatos and quince. His family, his son and his wife, help him to watch after the animals and farm. Nazim is 61 years old, he and his wife are pensioners. He wants to obtain a loan of 800 AZN to buy feeds for the animals. This will help him to raise the animals and sell them.

loans.use: To buy feed for the animals.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 26 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y muy emprendedora. Claudia vive con su hijo de 9 años en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Ibarra.

Claudia trabaja en la confección de abrigos, le va muy bien en este negocio ya que lo que confecciona vende y tiene muy buena clientela, al momento tiene que cubrir un pedido de abrigos y necesita comprar tela térmica para abrigos, trabajo que le permitirá obtener buenos ingresos y logrará que sus clientes sean mas fieles a ella, con esto Claudia podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.

Claudia sueña con tener masl clientela en toda la provincia y en el país ser una gran distribuidora para poder darle el estudio que se merece su hija.
texts.en:
Claudia, 26, tells us that she is a happy person, hard-working and entrepreneurial.  She lives with her 9-year old daughter in Atuntaqui, about 15 minutes from Ibarra.  

Claudia makes coats for a living.  She tells us that she has loyal customers and can sell everything that she makes.  She has an order for coats that she has to fill and she will use this loan to buy insulated material for making them.  The investment will allow her to meet demand from her customers and grow her business.  The happier her customers are, she says, the better her income and, in turn, her and her daughter's quality of life.

Claudia hopes to grow her business around the country so that she can earn enough to provide her daughter with the best educaiton possible.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is 26 years old and single. He has been selling electronic items for two years. He has a monthly income of 20,000 shillings. He has previously taken out two loans which have been successfully been paid back.

The loan that he acquires will be used to expand his business by purchasing  computers and laptops for sale. The profit that will be generated will be used to invest in his business.

He hopes that his business will expand and that he will become financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase laptops and computers for sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 50 years old and married with eight children: three single children and five married children. She works hard in the field because she aims to improve her family's standard of living. She owns a few hectares of farmland, on which she plants and harvests rice and potatoes for sale. Typically, she is able to make approximately USD 2.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has been in this business for nearly 20 years.

To improve the business, Chea is asking for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to hire a few laborers to work on her potato plantation. She mentioned that this is her first loan, which will enable her to improve her business and hopes that she will have a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to hire a few laborers to work on her potato plantation.

loans.name: Phlong

texts.en:
Phlong is a 53-year-old married woman who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She and her husband help each other in managing their rice farming business, raising the family and providing education to all of their children. At this time, five of her children are already married and have their own families while the other two children are single and still students in a high-school level of education. 

Phlong is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from our lenders to add to her capital to purchase farming supplies and pay for the operating expenses. She believes the loan will be a great help for her to manage her business well and attain her goal. She will save some of her generated income for her two children who are preparing to go to college in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay for the operating expenses.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna is married and has six children. Three of them work while the others stay at home. She is very skillful and knows the art of embroidery. She knows about the latest trends in fashion and does beautiful embroidery on clothes.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy embroidery material such as beads and embroidery thread in bulk quantity that will allow her to complete her clients' orders on time and increase her income.

She has been operating her business for the past many years and is confident that her business will get more success after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Amna.

loans.use: To buy beads and threads for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam, age 32, generates her income by engaging in a crop-farming business. She lives happily with her husband and three school-aged children in a small village, Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She primarily grows and harvests rice crops followed by potatoes and vegetables. She aims to upgrade her standard of living so she can send all of her children to college after they finish their education at high school. 

Eam hopes to improve and strengthen her farming business and make it more profitable. She is taking out a loan of KHR 500,000 to add to her capital to pay for laborers she hired to work her potato plantation. She believes that her loan will enable her to make improvements in her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers she hired to work her potato plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and supplies for her juice-making business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 35 años, su pareja es Marcelino, con quien tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 11 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la producción de achiote, frutas cítricas (naranjas, mandarinas y limones), plátanos y café. “Mis ventas son buenas, depende de quién sea el comprador”, menciona. Sus principales compradores son acopiadores de café, empresarios que exportan achiote y negociantes mayoristas que llevan los plátanos y cítricos hacia otras ciudades para la venta al menudeo. Su trabajo es intenso, por eso Marcelino es su apoyo incondicional, pero también tiene que contratar personal para optimizar el trabajo. 

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar las cuotas como en oportunidades anteriores. Pertenece a un banco comunal sólido y responsable llamado “Huacamayo”, se siente a gusto con sus socios.
Invertirá este dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Olga is 35 years old, and with her partner, Marcelino, she has three children who are 16, 12, and 11 years old. They all live in their own home located in the native community Huacamayo.

She works in agriculture, producing achiote, citrus fruits (oranges, mandarins, and lemons), bananas, and coffee. "My sales are good, depending on who the buyer is," she mentions. Her principal buyers are coffee middlemen or stockpilers, businessmen who export achiote, and wholesalers who take the bananas and citrus fruits to other cities for retail sale. Her work is intense, so Marcelino gives her unconditional support. But they also have to hire people to optimize the work.

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments as she has with her past opportunities. She belongs to a solid and responsible communal bank called "Huacamayo," and she feels at ease with the other members. 

She will invest this money in paying day laborers that she will hire for the cleaning of her different crops.

loans.use: to pay for day laborers who will work on her crops.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los angeles, soltera con 43 años de edad, 7 años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual es la venta de refrescos naturales, ubicado en su casa de habitacion, esta emprendedora inico con esta herramienta de trabajo para poder ayudar con los gastos de  su familia, el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de frutas para la elaboracion de los refrescos  como: bananos,papaya, naranjas, calala,  chia, piña, linaza, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria de los Ángeles is 43 years old and single.  She has seven years experience in her business selling soft drinks made from natural ingredients.  Her business is located in her home.  This entrepreneur started her work in order to be able to help cover her family's expenses.  She would like this loan to buy fruit so that she can make her soft drinks.  She will buy bananas, papaya, oranges, passion fruit, chia, pineapple, linseed, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit for making soft drinks (bananas, papaya, oranges, passion fruit, chia, pineapple, linseed, etc.)

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is married and has three sons and a daughter. Due to financial constrains she couldn’t provide them with an education. She is very supportive in nature and sews clothes for her local clients. She got these skills from her mother and now she earns a reasonably good income every month which helps her to pay her utility bills.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s animal-selling business. With the loan investment he will buy larger numbers of goats and sheep. He will raise them and will then sell them to butchers. He is very experienced in his business and Suriya is hopeful of his business success after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Suriya.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for an animal-selling business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old. He is married to Irene, and together they have four school-going children. He operates a motorcycle business in Nakuru. He has been in this business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 25,000 from the business.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to service his motorcycle. He plans to use the anticipated profits to purchase another motorcycle so as to expand his business.

He hopes to start up a retail shop for his wife in the near future.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, single, and has two children. She operates a cafeteria. She makes food and sells it to her customers. She has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it for purchasing food like sugar, meat, and rice for her business. She plans to use the profit for building her own shop. She hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food like sugar, meat, and rice for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 28-year-old married businessman. He has been running his music store for about six years and earns an income of about KES 30,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. He wants to use it to buy more CDs and DVDs to sell. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and give his two children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a widow with five children with ages ranging from 15 to 27. She describes herself as an intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sodas, juices, water, sweets etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are passengers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of goods. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more sodas and cakes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children and cater for her family's financial needs with her anticipated profits as she is the sole provider for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and cakes.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia Dora pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” y este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de calca y departamento de Cusco. La socia Dora nació en la ciudad de Yanatile pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Calca; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 3 hijos. 

Su actividad económica de la socia Dora es  la venta y compra de oro. La socia Dora solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de oro. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de oro y le va muy bien. 

La socia Dora agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Dora, belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner community bank in Calca, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She was born in the city of Yanatile and now lives in Calca.  Dora, 48, is married and the fruit of this happy relationship is the couple's 3 children.

Dora operates a business buying and selling gold.  She is applying for a loan that will use to buy gold.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it's very successful.  

Dora is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy gold for her trading business.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 54 años, está casada con Alberto, con quien tiene siete hijos, pero sólo viven con cuatro de ellos. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Cuenta con seis parcelas donde produce cítricos, plátanos y achiote. Lleva como 20 años en esta actividad y está segura de su rentabilidad, mas aún de los cítricos y el achiote, porque los precios son buenos y la demanda nunca baja. De esa manera logró mantener y educar a los hijos que ya no viven con ella, y espera brindarle mejores oportunidades a los que todavía están en su poder.
A la vez, tiene una pequeña bodeguita donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona, así obtiene ingresos extras para su familia. Felicita anhela crecer en sus dos actividades, por eso trabajará como lo hace hasta ahora.

Este es el crédito número 7 que recibe de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, del que se siente contenta por el trabajo en equipo.
Felicita invertirá el dinero en dos partes; la mitad en bolsas de abono y la otra mitad para comprar productos comestibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
Felicita is 54 years old and married to Alberto, with whom she has seven children; only four of them still live with her.  They live together in their own home located in Huacamayo.

She has six parcels of land where she produces citrus, bananas and annatto.  She has been carrying out this activity for 20 years, and is sure of its profitability; most of all the citrus and annatto since the prices are very good and demand never decreases.  In this manner, she managed to support and educate the children who are now on their own.  She hopes to provide better opportunities for those that still live with her.

Concurrently, she has a small store where she offers basic needs products to the townspeople of her area, thereby earning additional income for her family.  Felicita wishes to grow in both activities, which is why she will work as she has up until now.

This is the 7th loan she is receiving from MFP, which is why she gives her word to make her monthly payments on time.  She belongs to the “Huacamayo” cooperative bank, where she feels very glad to be working with a team.

Felicita will invest the funds in two parts; half into bags of fertilizer, and the other half into buying food products for her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops and food products for her store.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo tiene 43 años, su pareja es Cirila, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Todos juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Él se dedica a la agricultura con la producción de cítricos, tiene cuatro terrenos donde produce distintas variedades de frutas: naranjas, mandarinas, limones, limas, tanyelos, tanyarinas y otros. Toda su producción la ofrece en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad más cercana ubicada a una hora de su localidad. De esa manera mantiene a su numerosa familia. Al lado de su esposa, ambos se esfuerzan mucho para obtener buenos resultados que se ven reflejados en las ventas de sus productos. Ahora Cirilo piensa abonar sus terrenos para que estén listos para las próximas cosechas, e iniciar una siembra de cacao. Mientras tanto, se encuentra trabajando en una hacienda donde recibe un pago mensual.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, cuyos socios son responsables y organizados.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar bolsas de abono para los cítricos y para el cacao que piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 43 years old and lives with his partner Cirila.  The couple have five children and they all live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Huacamayo.

Cirilo is a farmer who grows citrus fruits.  He has four plots of land where he grows different varieties of fruit: oranges, mandarins, lemons, limes, tangelos, tangerines, etc.  He sells all of his produce in the wholesale market in the nearest city which is one hour from his town.  In this way, he is able to support his large family.  Cirilo and his wife both work hard in order to obtain good results.  This is reflected in the sales of their products.  Cirilo is now planning to fertilize his land so that it is ready for his upcoming harvests.  He would also like to start a crop of cacao.  In the meantime, he is working on a large farm where he receives a monthly wage.

This is Cirilo's seventh loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He is a member of the 'Huacamayo' community bank whose members are responsible and organized.

Cirilo will use his loan money to buy sacks of fertilizer for his citrus fruits and for the cacao that he plans to sow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old, married and has two children. He runs a shoe sales business, and has been in this business for eight years. He earns a monthly income of about 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 
This will be Charles' first loan with Kiva partner KADET. He plans to use it to purchase more stock of plastic shoes and sandals. He plans to use his profits to purchase a plot of land. He hopes to be a prosperous businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic shoes and sandals for the business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 27 years old and married with two children. She has run a retail shop for three years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).
This will be Margaret's third loan with Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use it to purchase stocks of sugar, rice and other goods. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to purchase a plot of land. In the future, she hopes to become a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Annualite

texts.en: Annualite is 20 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have one child aged one year. Annualite sells different items including yeast, sugar, and salt. She has been in this business for the past two years. With her loan, Annualite wants to buy more yeast, sugar and salt for resale. She will use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more yeast, sugar, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Nehemías

texts.es:
Nehemías tiene 59 años, está casado con Hermelinda, con quien tiene siete hijos, pero solo dos de ellos están en su poder. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Desde pequeño él creció en el campo, por eso se desempeña muy bien en las labores agrícolas. 
Posee nueve parcelas distribuidas con frutas cítricas, plátanos, achiote y cacao. Así puede vender sus productos en cualquier mes del año obteniendo ingresos para su familia. Sus productos tienen buena aceptación en el mercado por al calidad. Menciona que el éxito de sus frutos está en los cuidados y en la prevención de enfermedades. Por eso no duda en invertir en bolsas de abono y en el pago de personal que limpia sus cultivos de la maleza que obstruye el normal crecimiento de sus plantas.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibirá de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. “Huacamayo” es el nombre de su banco comunal, donde se siente identificado por el trabajo en equipo que realizan.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Nehemías is 59 years old and married to Hermelinda, with whom he has seven children; only two of them still live with him.  This family lives in their own home located in Huacamayo.

He grew up in the country from a young age, which is why he does so well at tasks related to farming.

He has nine parcels distributed with citrus, bananas, annatto and cacao crops.  This way, he can sell his products year-round and obtain income for his family.  His products are well accepted at the market due to their quality.  He mentions that the success of his fruits lies in care and disease prevention.  For this reason, he has no doubts about investing in sacks of fertilizer and labor to clear his crops of weeds that obstruct their normal growth.

This is the 5th loan he will receive from MFP, which is why he will take responsibility for making his loan payments on time.  The name of his cooperative bank is “Huacamayo”, and he feels identified by the work they carry out as a team there.  

With the funds from this loan, he will be able to pay the day laborers that will clear the weeds from his crops.

loans.use: to pay the day laborers that will work on his crops.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon is 38 years old and a married woman who is responsible for four children. She lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she operates a sales business from her home. She sells various kinds of grocery items, including some vegetables, earning at least USD $2 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a rice cultivator as well as a traditional Khmer musician.
In order to make improvements and increase household income, Pon would like to borrow USD $1,300 to purchase a tuk tuk for her son to provide a service to people around their commune. This will help the family increase their income so they can satisfy their living needs. In the future, Pon hopes that she will be able to send some of her children to college as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her son to provide a service to local people.

loans.name: Willison

texts.en:
Willison is a married man. He has two children aged seven months and seven years. He describes himself as a determined man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sodas, juices, water, sweets etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located near a bus station and his primary customers are passengers. Willison describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of goods. 
Willison will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more items such as water, sodas, juices, etc. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to use his anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sweets, biscuits, water, etc.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en: Evariste is aged 51. He is a father of four children aged between six and fourteen. He sells shoes and handbags and has been in this business for the past five years. With this loan, Evariste wants to buy more shoes and handbags for resale. He will use the profits from his business to renovate and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 26 years old. She is married with one child who is three years old. 
Jeanne has been selling bananas for ten years. Her loan will be used to buy more bananas for resale. She will use the profits from the business to buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 32 años de edad. Vive en unión libre,  tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Claudia tiene un negocio de venta de comida rápida como: pollo con tajadas, pastelitos, baleadas y tortilla con quesillo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa, vende todo el día y sus ventas son rentables. Claudia inicio este negocio con la necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Claudia solicita su quinto préstamo de 5,000 lempiras para comprar insumos para la elaboración de las comidas como, condimentos, carnes, verduras, maseca, harina, frijoles, lácteos, huevos etc. otra parte la invertirá en mandar hacer una carpa para cubrirse del agua o el sol y poder vender mejor en el negocio.  Con esta inversión piensa darle mejor comodidad a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio y seguirle ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 32, is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.  She lives with her family in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Claudia has a business selling fast food like chicken with plantain slices, pastries, “baleadas” [stuffed tortillas], and tortillas with cheese.  The business is located in her house.  She sells all day, and her sales are profitable.  Claudia started this business out of the need to generate income to help with the household expenses.

Claudia is requesting her fifth loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy supplies to make the food.  She will buy things like condiments, meat, vegetables, instant corn flour, flour, beans, dairy products, and eggs, etc.  She will use part of the loan to have an awning made to be protected from the water or the sun and be able to sell better in her business.  With this investment she plans on making her customers more comfortable.

Her goal is to continue working in her business and to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies like condiments, meat, vegetables, instant corn flour, flour, beans, dairy products, and eggs, etc. and to have an awning made to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
Natali tiene 28 años, su pareja es Benito, con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años. 
Ellos se dedican a la agricultura, tienen tres parcelas que la comunidad le otorgó donde producen cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas, limas, limones), plátanos y cacao. Natali cosecha sus frutos cítricos una vez al año y esta actividad dura como tres meses, que puede ser cualquier mes del año. Mientras que el plátano lo coge dos veces al mes, de esa manera puede solventar sus necesidades básicas del día a día. “Hace un año que produzco cacao y este año no botó mucho, pero el próximo año cosecharé el doble”, menciona. Natali piensa adquirir más terrenos para producir más cacao y plátanos, por eso seguirá invirtiendo en sus cultivos.

Este es el crédito número 7 que recibe de MFP, por eso se siente agradecida del apoyo brindado. Pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, cuyos socios son responsables y solidarios.
Destinará este dinero en la compra de mamones de plátano que le cuestan 50 céntimos cada uno. Además comprará bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Natali is 28 years old and has a 12-year old child with her partner, Benito.

They dedicate themselves to farming, and have three parcels that the community granted them where they produce citrus (oranges, mandarins, limes, lemons), bananas and cacao.  Natali harvests her citrus fruits once a year and this activity, which can be at any time of year, lasts for about three months.
