Meanwhile, she harvests the bananas twice a month so that she can continue to meet their day-to-day needs.  “It’s been a year since I produced cacao, and this year it did not yield much, but I will harvest double the amount next year,” she mentions.  Natali is thinking about acquiring additional land to produce more cacao and bananas, which is why she will continue investing in her crops.

This is the 7th loan she receives from MFP, and she feels very thankful for the support provided.  She belongs to the “Huacamayo” cooperative bank, whose members are responsible and united.  

She will use these funds to buy banana plants, which cost 50 cents each.  In addition, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy banana plants and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is 41 years old, married, and has four children: two are married and two are single. She lives with her family in a peaceful village in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She and her husband work together in the same business of cultivating rice. They aim to provide a good education for their children, so they might have good jobs in the future without working hard in the rice field as they have had to. In addition, Chhay's husband runs a transportation business, providing his services with a horse-pulled trailer to local people.
Due to a shortage of capital, Chhay would like to ask for a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase a strong horse for the transportation business. She hopes to obtain the loan, which will enable her to improve the business and thereby increase household income. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a strong horse for her transportation business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man. He has two children aged 8 and 17. He describes himself as a determined and God-fearing man. He operates a retail stall where he sells items such as sodas, juices, water, sweets, etc. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located within a bus station and his primary customers are passengers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of goods.
Richard will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more confectionery and water. His business goal is to venture into a real estate housing business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children and build a house for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of confectionery and water.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is married with three children who all go to school. She is 47 years old. 
Alphonsine sells a variety of items in her shop. With this loan, she will buy more salt and rice for resale. She will use the profits from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more salt and rice for resale.

loans.name: Nereyda

texts.es: Nereyda de 28 años de edad, se desempeña como responsable de ventas, su esposo trabaja como Taxista de su propio vehiculo, ambos son trabajadores y reconocido en el municipio.  Este credito lo requieren para comprar materiales de construccción para mejorar para hecharle la ceramica a sala de  su vivienda ubicada para asi brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida,  su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan sano y gozar de estabilidad laboral para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Nereyda is 28 years old and she is a sales representative. Her husband is a taxi driver working with his own car, and they both are hard-working people well-known in their municipality. They need the loan she is requesting to buy construction materials to make improvements to their house by tiling the floor of her living room in order to grant better living conditions to their family. She wishes a healthy growth for her children and she dreams of enjoying working stability in order to help her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Esther has been working hard to manage her small palm oil sales business. 
To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more palm oil for resale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay her medical expenses. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 
Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Esther's future prospects by helping her to learn how to use family planning methods.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is 35 years old. She is a single mother of three children aged between 10 and 15.
Jacquline has been selling bed sheets and handbags for seven years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more stocks of handbags for resale. The profit she derives will be used to buy and build on a plot of land.
This is Jacquline's first loan with Kiva partner KADET. Her hope and dream for her future business is to purchase many plots of land.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of handbags and bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años, su pareja es Camilo, con quien tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años. 
Hace 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y perfeccionó al lado de su esposo. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido sacar a delante a sus dos hijos quienes ahora se encuentran en edad escolar. Luz produce café y naranjas en dos parcelas de terreno. Menciona que la cosecha de cítricos es menos cansada y de menos inversión, pero los precios de venta a veces no son tan buenos. Por otro lado, el café requiere de mucho cuidado e inversión, pero sus precios son satisfactorios. Ahora sembrará plátanos. Luz confía que adquirirá nuevos terrenos y producirá más café y naranjas. Es una de sus metas más cercanas.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, del que se siente contenta por tener socios emprendedores.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar mamones de plátano cuyo precio es de 50 céntimos cada uno. También comprará bolsas de abono para empezar con éxito esta siembra.
texts.en:
Luz, age 27, and her life partner, Camilo, have two children, ages nine and seven.

Luz has been working in agriculture for ten years.  She learned how to do this from her parents, and she perfected her work alongside her husband.  Thanks to her effort she has been able to get her two school age children ahead.

Luz produces coffee and oranges on two parcels of land.  She says that harvesting the citrus is less tiring and less of an investment.  However, the prices they sell for at times are not so good.  Now she will plant bananas.

Luz is confident that she will get new land and produce more coffee and oranges.  This is one of her closest goals.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly payments.  She belongs to the Huacamayo communal bank.  She is happy that it has enterprising members.

She will use the money from this loan to buy banana plants at 50 cents per each one.  She will also buy bags of fertilizer to successfully  start her next planting.

loans.use: to buy banana plants and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 28-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. 

Stephen describes himself to be visionary and a determined man in his work. He operates a self-made paper temporary retail stall where he sells items such as sodas, juices, water, and sweets. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a local residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Stephen will use the loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more confectionery and water. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a permanent premise for carrying out his business operation.

loans.use: to buy more confectionery and water.

loans.name: Annonciatte

texts.en: Annonciatte is 38 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling foodstuffs for 16 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more variety of foodstuffs such as rice, bananas, cassava, and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, and potatoes for sell.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en: The focus of Adalat's business is selling milk products. He started his business with one cow, and now he has one cow and two calves. He is 43 years old and has three children ages 9, 8, and 1. He wants to increase the number of animals to make his family's living conditions better. He has applied for a loan of 1600 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy a cow with its calf.

loans.use: To buy a cow with its calf.

loans.name: Ereda

texts.en: Ereda is 43 years old. She sells bananas and has spent fifteen years in the business. She has requested the loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 22 años, junto al padre de su hijo,(de 5 años) viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Yolanda es una mujer del campo, le gusta coger las herramientas y trabajar en sus parcelas. Ella cultiva café y plátanos en dos parcelas que la comunidad le otorgó. Su esposo no se pasa mucho tiempo con ella por motivos de trabajo, por eso ella ve por conveniente contratar personal operario para que la apoyen en las tareas cansadas de la agricultura. Gracias a esta inversión puede cosechar a tiempo sus productos y negociarlos con eficiencia. En sus 3 años en la actividad se dio cuenta que requiere de mucha inversión producir café, pero también sabe que después de vender sus granos sus recompensas son buenas. Por eso quiere ampliar su producción, poco a poco, de acuerdo a los ahorros que genere de su trabajo. 

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y da su palabra de ser puntual en le pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, un grupo de socios responsables como ella.
Destinará este dinero en el pago de personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de café que terminó de cosechar hace poco.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 22 and lives with the father of her 5-year-old son  in their own house in the native community of Huacamayo. 

Yolanda is a country woman, she likes to take her tools and work in her plots. She grows coffee and plantain in the two plots that the community gave her.

Because of his work, her husband can't spend too much time with her, that is why she sees it as convenient to hire operative personnel so they can help her with the hardest jobs in agriculture. Thanks to this investment she can harvest her produce on time and make business with efficiency.

In her 3 years of experience she has realised that producing coffee requires big investments but she also knows that after selling her grains her rewards are good; That is why she  wants to expand her production, little by little, according to the savings she can generate with her job.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she gives her word that she will make pay her loan instalments on time.

She belongs to the communal banca Huacamayo, a group that has members as responsible as she is.

She will use the money of her loan to pay the workers that she will hire to clean her coffee crops that she finished harvesting not long ago.

loans.use: to pay the people that will help with her crops

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 46 years old, married to Maritha, and blessed with two children, aged 13 and 11 years, respectively. He owns a posho mill, a business he started 10 years ago, and which earns him a monthly income of KES 13,700. 

He is requesting a first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase diesel to drive the machines, and bags of maize for sale. The profit he earns from it will help him pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to continue with his business, as well as educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase diesel for driving the machines and bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Musee

texts.en:
Musee is 52 years old and supports seven people in the family. He is married and his spouse contributes additional income.

He has been in business for 10 years and derives a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and tea for sale. The profits will be used to expand his business by purchasing more stock.

This is the second loan from KADET LTD, but he successfully paid back the previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to have a building on his plots.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and sweets.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is 45 years old and has four children. She operates a beauty salon and has three employees. She also sells beauty products. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her expand her business.

She has learned how to manage her finances because she has been trained on business management skills. She hopes to operate a bigger outlet in the future. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a hair dryer and hair braids.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair braids

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 41 years old. He lives in a small village in the Akhmeta District with his family: his parents, a brother and an 8-year-old niece. His parents are pensioners, and his brother is a shepherd. Badri runs an agricultural business. He has milk cows and produces cheese, which is sold on the local open market. He also has pigs and sells piglets. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Badri requested a loan to build a cattle shed for his livestock. After he builds the cattle shed, he will be able to keep more pigs. This will increase the sales from his business. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business in order to expand it and make it more profitable, meaning that the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Irene is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her market business, which sells vegetables like tomatoes. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes for resale and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Irene hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Irene's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria tiene 38  años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural en al zona de Lambayeque dentro de comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias y cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua.
 
Ella se especializa en la crianza y  comercialización  de animales, a lo cual se ha dedicado desde que tenia 18años de edad. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. 

El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra  de arroz en verde, adicional a esto cuanta con ¾ de Ha sembrados con arroz y ya cuenta con 2 campañas exitosas de comercio de arroz en verde. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización debido a la demanda del cereal en los meses de julio y agosto. Precisamente el prestamo es particularmente importante en este momento debido a la seasonality del producto.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 38 years old, she is married and she has 2 children who economically depend on her. She lives in her own house in the rural area of Lambayeque, in a small community of about 100 families, and her house is equipped with electricity and running water.

She breeds and sells animals, an activity she is has been engaging in since she was 18. Her activity is located in her own house, and she has learned her job form her parents, which is why she knows the trade perfectly.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy newly harvested rice to add it to the ¾ of an hectare she has already planted with rice and she has already successfully sold newly harvested rice twice. She faces big competition for this activity, but at the same time there is a wide market for this product, due to the high request of cereals in the months of July and August; and it is particularly important to request a loan in this moment because this is the good season for this product.

loans.use: To buy more newly harvested rice to keep of selling it with profit.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, 30 years old and married, has been operating a butcher shop to earn a living for nine years. Previously, he ran a grocery shop. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, James has learnt how to save because he has been trained in financial management and hopes to open another outlet in a different location in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more meat for his shop.

loans.use: to buy meat for his shop.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 61 years old. He lives in a small village in Telavi district with his wife and father. All three are pensioners. They run an agricultural business. They have pigs and a plot of land where various vegetables are grown: cucumbers, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, and beets. 

Vazha sells the agricultural products using his own car in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari.

Vazha requested a loan in order to purchase greengrocery products for resale. He will purchase them from neighboring farmers and resell them on the open market in the nearby town. 

With this loan, he will increase the turnover of his products. As a result, he expects his monthly income to increase accordingly, enabling him to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase greengrocery products for resale.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 52 years old. He is married and lives in the small village of Sabue with his family: his wife, Manana, and two children (16 and 17 years old). Both of the children go to the local school. Manana is the teacher. She teaches in the village school and is a lovely teacher for her children. 

Guram runs an agricultural business. In particular he has cows, pigs, and calves. He produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. He sells pigs and calves as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. 

Guram requested a loan to purchase calves. He wants to raise them and sell then locally after several months. Grown calves will be sold with a price mark-up. The family will get additional income. 

With the increased income, he will be able to expand his agricultural business. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for goverment permit for her activity.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en: Frederic is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been selling soda and beer for sixteen years. The loan will be used to add more beer and sodas to his stock to sell. With the profits, he will take care of his basic home needs. In the future, he would like to own a depot for both soda and beer.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Yovver

texts.es:
Yovver tiene 30 años, vive junto a la madre de sus tres hijos (de 9, 7 y 5 años) en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 10 años y gracias a las enseñanzas que sus padres le brindaron ahora puede hacerse cargo de su joven familia trabajando las tierras con esfuerzo. En sus tres parcelas cultiva achiote y café, productos más rentables por sus buenos precios, pero que requieren de mucho cuidado e inversión. De sus terrenos obtiene como 35 sacos de café de 60 kilos cada uno, los que negocia en la ciudad que se ubica a 30 minutos de su localidad. Yovver sabe que la agricultura es lo que mejor sabe hacer por eso continuará con sus labores por mucho tiempo. 

Este es el crédito número 7 que recibe de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Huacamayo”, un grupo de socios responsables y solidarios.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá adquirir más plantas de café, cada una cuesta 50 céntimos y necesitará como 4 mil plantitas para iniciar con éxito una siembra.
texts.en:
Yovver is 30 years old and lives with the mother of his three children, who are nine, seven, and five, in the native community of Huacamayo.

He has been working in agriculture for over ten years and, thanks to all the knowledge he learned from his parents, he can now take care of his young family by working the land with effort. He grows achiote and coffee on his three plots of land. These products are the most profitable, due to their good price, but they require a lot of care and high investments. He obtains about 35 sacks of coffee beans from his land, each containing 60 kilos, and he sells them in the city located 30 minutes away from his town. Yovver knows that agriculture is what he knows best, which is why he will continue with his work for a long time.

This is the 7th loan he receives from MFP, so he gives his word that he will pay his monthly installments timely. He belongs to the communal bank Huacamayo, which is a group of responsible and supportive members.

The money from this loan will allow him to purchase more coffee plants. Each one costs 50 cents, and he will need about 4,000 small plants to successfully start his crop.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants.

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité San Jose Obrero nace mediante la promoción de una de las miembros, quien buscando un beneficio para sus amigas se informo y de allí surgió el comité. Ellas se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra.Olga, es casada tiene 39 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a las integrantes de su comité a salir adelante. Ella tiene una cantina donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser bebidas, golosinas, y gracias a lo cual puede tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Olga solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, golosinas, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The San Jose Obrero Communal Bank was created by one of its members who was looking for a way to benefit her friends, became informed and thus promoted the group. It has as its main objective the growth of each of its members, all of whom are well known in the community as very hardworking women.

Sra. Olga is married, 39 years old and an enterprising and hardworking woman who is also very optimistic, She encourages the other members to move ahead. She has a snack bar where she sells all kinds of items, such as drinks and sweets. Thanks to her business she has the means necessary to be able to help her family.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with drinks, sweets and other supplies so she can continue working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, sweets and other supplies.

loans.name: Mindia

texts.en:
Mindia is 31 years old. He lives in a small village of Telavi District with his family, wife Elene and his parents. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with milking cows. They produce dairy foods like cheese, curds, and yogurt and sell them on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.
 
Mindia requested credit for the expansion of the dairy farm. He plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows. With more milk cows the family will be able to double production and sales of dairy food and the income of the family will significantly increase. With increased profits, Mindia will be able to repair their house, which is old and uncomfortable. As a result of the above mentioned activities, all members of the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes's group is comprised of  hard working women. Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car for herself. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Robizon

texts.en:
Robizon is 25 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Telavi District with his family, wife Megi, his father, and his 3-year-old daughter. Megi is a housewife. Robizon and his father are busy with farming. They have a plot of land, where cucumbers, tomatoes, potatoes, and maize are grown. They are especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell on the local open market. Together with their own agricultural activities they help locals in farming and get service fees for the work. Their total average monthly income is 600 Lari. 

Robizon requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. He will be able to produce cheese. Part of the cheese will be used by the family and the rest will be sold on the local open market. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs and their living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Mania

texts.en:
Mania is 51 years old. She lives in a small village in Kvareli District with her mother. Her mother is a pensioner. Mania runs an agricultural business. She has 6 pigs and sells piglets in nearby villages. She also has 1.5 hectares of land where maize is grown. She works hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. 

Mania requested a loan to build a cattle shed. She will purchase construction materials and pay for the workers who will build the shed. Mania will purchase pigs and grow them. With the increased number of pigs she will be able to sell more piglets. As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the monthly profit of the family will increase. Mania will use the increase in income for repairing the house. Thus, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard work day in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 51 años, está casada con Avilio, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero solo vive con tres de ellos.
A pesar de su edad continúa en las labores arduas de la agricultura, posee cuatro parcelas donde cultiva achiote y frutas cítricas como naranjas, mandarinas, limones, lima y otros. “Cultivar cítricos es relajado, solo se tiene que quitar la maleza y abonar el terreno”, menciona. Haciendo una comparación con el cultivo de achiote, éste requiere de más cuidados, por los insectos y enfermedades que le puede entrar si no los cuida a tiempo. En sus más de 30 años trabajando en el campo, siente que la agricultura es su vida, porque sabe hacerlo bien y negociar sus productos con inteligencia. 

Este es su préstamo número 7 con MFP y menciona que será puntual en los pagos. A agrace el apoyo una vez más y la confianza que ponen en su trabajo. Ella pertenece a un banco comunal sólido y solidario, llamado “Huacamayo”.
El dinero de este préstamo lo destinará en la compra de más plantas de fruta que cuestan 2 soles cada una, necesitará como 400 plantas. Lo restante lo invertirá en bolsas de abono.
texts.en:
Zoila is 51 years old and is married to Avilio, with whom she has five children, three of whom still live with them

Despite her age, Zoila continues her arduous work as a farmer. She owns four plots where she cultivates annatto (a tropical tree which produces an orange-red dye derived from the seeds of its fruit) and citrus fruits, such as oranges, mandarins, lemons, limes and others. “Cultivating citrus fruits is relaxing: you only have to pull weeds and fertilize the soil,” she states. She compares this to the cultivation of annatto, which requires a lot more care because of the insects and plaques that can emerge if they are not prevented in time. With more than 30 years working in the fields, she feels that farming is her life because she knows both how to do it well and how to intelligently negotiate the price of her crops.

This is loan number 7 from MFP. She notes that she will be punctual in making her payments. She is grateful once again for the support and the confidence shown in her work. She belongs to a solid and supportive communal bank called “Huacamayo.”

She will use the money from this loan to purchase more fruit plants, which cost 2 soles each and she will need 400 plants. The remainder, she will invest in sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase fruit plants and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 38 years old and supports five children in her family. She is married to Steven who provides additional income for the family. She has five children aged between eight and 17 years old.

She has been in business for seven years and currently derives an additional income of forty four thousand Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to purchase baking materials.


The anticipated profits will be used to build her own house and stop paying rent. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams for the future are that the business expands and that she starts another bigger business.

loans.use: to boost her business by purchasing baking materials

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 55 years old. She lives in a small village of Telavi District with her family: 22-year-old daughter, Sopiko, and a sister who is a pensioner. 

Lena is busy with trading. She sells seasonal clothes for women, men, and children. She sells them from home. Her daughter helps her in her business. She buys all her merchandise in the capital. 

Lena has been carrying out this activity by herself for more than five years and has become well-known and has been increasing the number of her regular customers. Because of high demand for her products, she often sells out everything she has available. 

She works hard but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of the house. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari.

Lena requested a loan to repair the roof of the house, which was damaged because of high snow. With this loan, she will be able to repair the roof. 

Also, she plans to make some savings in the future to renovate the house and purchase furniture in order to make their life in the village more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Monte Negro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Monte Negro está integrado por cinco personas originarias de la comunidad de Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca donde la mayoría de las personas habla el idioma mixteco.

Uno de los integrantes del grupo es el señor Florentino de cuarenta y tres años de edad, quien se dedica a trabajar su taxi el cual  pertenece a un sitio llamado Kasandoo ubicado en su localidad. Florentino explica que la palabra "Kasandoo" significa “casa de adobe” en mixteco. Él lleva trabajando como taxista tres años, y para él, han sido los mejores años que ha tenido ya que hace lo que le gusta: ayudar a las personas ofreciendo su servicio o dando un aventón a quienes en verdad lo necesitan. Con el objetivo de seguir brindando un buen servicio, Florentino pidió un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su taxi. 

Para Don Florentino, una de las mejores experiencias que ha tenido como taxista fue cuando subió a una persona a su taxi y la llevó a su destino aunque esta no tenía dinero para pagar; después de tiempo, se encontró a la misma persona, exactamente cuando él necesitaba a alguien para platicar asuntos personales. Debido a la confianza que generó lo sucedido en el primer encuentro, Don Florentino se sintió cómodo platicando lo que le sucedía entonces. 

De acuerdo con sus propias palabras, una de las características que debe tener una persona para ser taxista es, más que nada, ser honesto ya que ocasiones los pasajeros dejan cosas de valor olvidadas en el taxi y es el momento perfecto donde uno puede practicar sus valores. Don Florentino dice que se considera una persona especial porque le gusta enfrentar las dificultades, ya que desde muy pequeño ha sabido cómo ganarse el pan de cada día y lo que cuesta hacerlo pues sus padres son personas son personas de bajos recursos. Además, en la visita realizada a Florentino, también quiso compartir una frase con la que se identifica demasiado: “En lugar de ser un hombre de éxito, busca ser un hombre valioso: lo demás llegará naturalmente.” 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Felipe - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Héctor Manuel - se dedica a la venta de comida.
Floriberta - se dedica a la venta  de comida.
Rosa - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudar a hombres y mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The Monte Negro group is made up of five people from the community of Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, where most people speak the Mixtec language.

One of the members of the group is the 40-year-old Florentino, who works driving a taxi in a place called Kasandoo, located in his area. Florentino explains that the word "Kasandoo" means "adobe house" in Mixtec. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years, and for him, they have been the best years of his life. Now, he can do what he enjoys: help people by offering his services or giving a ride to those who really need it. With the goal of continuing his good service, Florentino is asking for a loan for maintenance on his taxi.

For Mr. Florentino, one of the best experiences that he has had as a taxi driver was when he picked up a person in his taxi and brought them to their destination even though they didn't have the money to pay him. After a while, he encountered the same person exactly when he needed to talk to somebody about personal matters. Thanks to the trust created by what happened in the first encounter, Mr. Florentino felt comfortable talking about what happened then.

According to his own words, one of the characteristics that a person should have in order to be a taxi driver is, more than anything, honesty. On occasion, passengers leave valuable things forgotten in the taxi and it's the perfect time for one to practice his/her virtues. Mr. Florentino says that he considers himself to be a special person because he likes to face difficulties. Since he was a small child, he has known how to earn his daily bread. It was difficult to do because his parents were people of few resources. In addition, in Florentino's visit, he wanted to share a phrase with which he greatly identifies: "In place of being a successful man, try to be a valuable man. The rest will come naturally."

The other members in the group are:

Felipe - works selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes
Hector Manuel - works selling food
Floriberta - works selling food
Rosa - works selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes

They give their thanks to Vision Fund for helping working men and women.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi and be able to afford service

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 15 лет Бахром занимается изготавлением национальных блюд. Также он занимается изготовлением нациогнальной самбусы. У него очень много клиентов и они все благодарны ему за то что у него вкусно получается. Бахром с 2007 года сотрудничает с «Имон Интенешнл», является хоршим клиентом с хорошим кредитным досье. Бахром хотел бы получить займ для покупки муки и топливо. Бахром надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bahrom is a hardworking and kind man. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Bahrom has been producing local foods for more than fifteen years. He also makes traditional Tajik sambosa. He has many customers and they are all thankful to him for his delicious food. Since 2007 Bahrom has been working with IMON International and is a good client with a good credit history. Bahrom wants to get a loan to buy flour and fuel. He is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy flour and fuel.

loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y muy responsable. María vive sola en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de ibarra.

María trabaja sola en la venta de ropa para bebes, negocio que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buenas clientes. María necesita incrementar su negocio ya que quiere incrementar sus ingresos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi para realizar la compra de ropa para bebes como medias, camisetas, busos, pantalones y cobijas. Incremento que ayudará a sus clientes a tener mas variedad y puedan escojer lo que ellos gusten.

María sueña en comprar una máquina especial para confeccionar ella misma la ropa para bebes.
texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria is 58 years old, and she can be described as a happy, hard-working and very responsable woman. Maria lives alone in Atuntaqui, which is 15 minutes from Ibarra.

Maria works by herself selling baby's clothing, and her business is going very well with good customers. Maria needs to expand her business in order to increase her income. For that reason, she is soliciting a loan through Fodemi to buy clothing for babys, such as socks, T-shirts, sports suits, pants, and balnkets. Increasing her inventory will help her customers select what they like from a greater variety.

Maria dreams of buying a special sewing machine so that she can make her own clothes for babys.

SPANISH

María tiene 58 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y muy responsable. María vive sola en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de ibarra.

María trabaja sola en la venta de ropa para bebes, negocio que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buenas clientes. María necesita incrementar su negocio ya que quiere incrementar sus ingresos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi para realizar la compra de ropa para bebes como medias, camisetas, busos, pantalones y cobijas. Incremento que ayudará a sus clientes a tener mas variedad y puedan escojer lo que ellos gusten.

María sueña en comprar una máquina especial para confeccionar ella misma la ropa para bebes.

loans.use: buy socks, T-shirts, sports suits, pants, and blankets, all for babies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be a visionary and determined woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as flour, sugar, sweets, sodas, bread, cooking fat, tea leaves, hair braids, etc. She has been involved in this business for ten years and employs one staff member. Her business is located near an estate and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more home products. Her business goal is to expand her retail shop to a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will run a supermarket using the anticipated profits generated.

loans.use: to buy more home products, etc.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 57 years old. He sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, he will buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be for building a house through making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kasandoo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kasandoo, está conformado por cuatro mujeres y dos hombres trabajadores y humildes originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, un lugar rico en flora y fauna.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Nancy de cuarenta y siete años de edad. Doña Nancy dice que se dedica a la venta de flores y arreglos florales desde hace trece años, los cuales ofrece en el mercado de su localidad. Anteriormente, vendía sus flores en un pequeño pueblo llamado Ocotlán, Oaxaca ya que su padres son originarios de la localidad. Comenta que desde los siete años dejó de asistir a la escuela  para dedicarse a la venta de flores, actividad que hoy en día la llena de satisfacción. Una de las cosas que más le gustan de su negocio es atender a sus clientes, siempre con amabilidad y manteniendo una sonrisa.

Algunos de los tipos de flores que Nancy vende son crisantemos, gladiolas, lilis, acapulcos, montecasino, solidago, leonardas, marceadas, nuves, polares, codornices y las eternas rosas. Comenta que las flores que más se venden son los crisantemos y las rosas. Doña Nancy dice que las características que necesita para realizar su trabajo son la creatividad y paciencia para realizar los arreglos florares y sobre todo inteligencia para escoger las flores más adecuadas para cada tipo de ocasión. Además, Nancy menciona que se considera una persona especial porque le gusta ser siempre una de las mejores respecto a su tipo de negocio para que no le afecte mucho la competencia. De hecho, una de las frases que Doña Nancy utiliza para llamar a sus cliente es: “Pásele, pásele, qué le damos, mire que aquí los apapachamos”, haciendo referencia también al buen servicio que ofrece. Ella pidió su crédito para comprar más flores y listones para continuar vendiendo arreglos.

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son:

Dominga Guillermina - se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Dionicia - se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Beda - se dedica a la venta de pan.
Donaciano - se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Valeriano Marcelino - se dedica a la venta de pollo.

Le dan las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudar a todas las personas trabajadoras y con las fuerzas para lograr lo que se propongan.
texts.en:
This group is called Kasandoo.  It is composed of six hardworking and modest members, four women and two men, from a small village called Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, a place rich in flora and fauna.

One of the members is Sra. Nancy, who is 47 years old. Doña Nancy says that she has been selling flowers and floral arrangements at the market in her area for 13 years. Formerly, she used to sell her flowers in a small village called Ocotlán, Oaxaca because her parents are natives of that community. She notes that at the age of seven she stopped attending school so she could sell flowers, a task that nowadays fills her with satisfaction. One of the things she most likes about her business is waiting on customers, which she always does graciously and with a smile.

Some of the kinds of flowers Nancy sells are gladiolas, lilies, the eternal rose and other varieties. She notes that those she sells most are chrysanthemums and roses. She says the characteristics she needs to do her work are creativity and patience in making her floral arrangements, as well as intelligence in choosing the most appropriate flowers for each type of occasion. In addition, Nancy mentions that she considers herself a rather special person because she always likes to be one of the best at her work, thus the competition does not affect her much. In fact, one of the phrases that Doña Nancy likes to use to greet her customers is “Come in, come in, look at what we have for you, look at how we pamper you here.” She requested her loan to purchase more flowers and ribbons to continue selling arrangements.

The other members of the group are:

Dominga Gullermina – sells tacos
Dionicia – sells fish
Beda – sells bread
Donaciano – sells groceries
Valeriano Marcelino – sells chickens.

They thank the Vision Fund for helping all the hardworking people and for their efforts in helping them obtain loans.

loans.use: to buy flowers and ribbons for floral arrangements.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 52 years old. She is a mother of three children aged between 20 and 30; two of them go to school, while the oldest completed studies. 

She has a boutique (market) which she has been running for a period of fourteen years. The loan will be used to buy rice, sodas, and soaps to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy rice and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Khatuni

texts.en:
Khatuni is 35 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District with her family: husband - Gocha, two children (8 and 15 years old) and father-in-law, who is a pensioner. Both of her children study in the village school. Her husband is a driver. He works for a local company and earns a monthly salary. Khatuni earns their living through agricultural business. She has a milking cow and produces cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold on the local open market. She also has 1 hectare of land and 2 greenhouses, where she grows all kinds of greens and sell them at Kutaisi market. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Khatuni decided to build the third greenhouse, because of high demand for greens in Kutaisi market and requested a loan for it. This will enable her to grow more greens during the entire year. The amount of harvested greens will increase and Khatuni will earn more income from sales. As a result of the above mentioned activities the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 42 years old. She sells shoes and has been in this business for seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 27 years old. She is married to a farmer. She sells sorghum and has spent four years in this business. With the loan, she will add more quantity of sorghum to be sold. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family. In the future, she would like to be a distributor.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of 7 hard-working women. Margret is 21 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort portal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry food like maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 650,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry food like maize for resale, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Margret's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more dry food like maize for resale

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Aminah has been working hard to manage her small business, selling cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Aminah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour for resale and will help Aminah to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Aminah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Aminah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Aminah's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for resale,

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de anticuchos (es como una parrila de corazon y carne,ella tiene un local donde vende los anticuchos desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es amplair y mejorar el negocio de venta de anticuchos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carne,corazon,aceite y carbon.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel Cirila continues working in her business selling anticucho (grilled heart and meat). She has a place where she sells her anticuchos from 4 a.m. until 6 p.m. Through her business she is moving her children forward. Her dream is to expand and improve her anticucho sales business. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, heart, oil and charcoal.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase meat, heart, oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 37 years old. She sells beans and sorghum. She has spent five years in this business. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal, 28 years old, has three children aged between 6 and 10, all attending school. She has been selling bananas and sorghum for ten years. Chantal plans to use this loan to add more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to feed the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Godberthe

texts.en: Godberthe, 76 years old, is very focused and dedicated to meeting her ends. She has spent 24 years in the same business, selling sorghum. Godberthe has requested this loan to buy more sorghum to sell. She will use the profits from the business for savings because in the future she would like to have a depot.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette, 27 years old, is married and has three children. She has a boutique where she sells different items such as rice, cooking oil and soaps. Jeannette wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil and rice. She plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha, aged 58, is a widow with one child who is 20 years old. She has sold bananas and sorghum for the past eighteen years. Josepha wants to use this loan to buy more sorghum and bananas to sell. She will use the profits from the business to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Joice's Group

texts.en:
Joice's group is comprised of five hard working women. Joice is 19 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Joice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Joice has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale and will help Joice to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Joice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Joice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Joice's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco, 26 years old, is single and takes care of one child. He sells different items such as soap, sugar, and cooking oil. Bosco wants to use this loan to buy sugar and more new items, such as rice, to sell. He will use the profits from the business to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Edson, who is in his early 40s, is married and has three children who go to school.  He has been running a business of selling secondhand clothes for seven years now.  He works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of secondhand clothing, started another business of looking for tenders for sewing children uniforms, bought sofa sets,  and paid school fees and household expenses.  He has paid all of his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to resell and materials for sewing school uniforms. His dream is to one day build his own house.

Edson will share this loan with his loan group "Wastara", which has a total of 16 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to resell and materials for sewing school uniforms.

loans.name: Rut

texts.es:
Rut tiene 23 años, su pareja es Anselmo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Huacamayo.
Ella es una madre jovial y una trabajadora ejemplar, posee tres cuadras de terreno donde siembra plátanos, achiote y naranjas. Ya cosechó el achiote y las naranjas hace poco, por eso ahora se esmera en la cosechas del plátano, el que dan sus frutos cada quince días. “El kilo de plátano ahora está 60 céntimos, pero hay días en que llega a costar 90 céntimos, sí es rentable, porque yo cosecho en gran cantidad”, dice. Rut invierte mucho dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contrata para el cultivo de sus sembríos. Le paga a cada uno 25 soles el día, pero si les da desayuno y almuerzo, se reduce a 20 soles el día.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por eso agradece la oportunidad. Ahora es parte de un grupo sólido llamada “Huacamayo”, al que se siente contenta de haber ingresado.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en el pago al personal que contratará para la limpieza de su platanal.
texts.en:
Rut, 23, lives with her partner, Anselmo and their three children, 6, 4 and 1 in their own house in the native community of Huacamayo.
She is a cheerful mother and an example of a hard worker.  Rut owns three cuadras (an agricultural measure) where she plants bananas, achiote (a spice) and oranges.  She began growing the achiote and oranges a little while ago, but now she is able to harvest the bananas every two weeks.  “A kilo of bananas is now 60 cents, but there are days when it reaches 90 cents. “The work is profitable because she produces a large quantity“, she says.  Rut will use the money to pay day laborers she contracts for the harvest.  She pays each one 25 sols per day but if she gives them breakfast and lunch, she reduces it to 20 sols per day.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity.  She is now part of a supportive group called “Huacamayo” where she feels happy to have joined.
She will use the money from this loan to pay the workers to clean the banana trees.

loans.use: to pay farm laborers to work with her crops

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en:
Dezi is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Dezi has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon.

To help expand her business, Dezi has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair stylers and dryers for the salon, and will help Dezi to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Dezi hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Dezi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Dezi's future prospects by helping her to learn how to use family planning methods.

loans.use: to buy more hair stylers and dryers for the salon.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. 

She owns a retail shop which has been in operation for five years and has been a source of constant income for the family. In this shop, she sells sugar, cooking oil, and washing detergents among other things. Besides this business, Janet is also a vendor of water.

She learned of Milango from her friends and joined in order to access credit for her business. Eunice is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

Eunice is optimistic that the sales will increase and she will finally open another retail shop. Her desire is to grow her future chain of businesses into a wholesale business. 

The additional income obtained from this loan will help her pay for her children’s education/school fees. The only challenge that Eunice faces is the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase native herbs and plants.

loans.name: Nzangi

texts.en:
Nzangi is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be determined in his work. 

He operates a retail stall where he sells items such as biscuits, sweets, water, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located near a bus station and his primary customers are passengers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy confectionery and water. His business goal is to run a big distributing shop within five years. Nzangi hopes to educate his children with profits that will be generated.

loans.use: to buy more confectionery and water.

loans.name: Agueda De Jesus

texts.es: Agueda de jesus, soltera con 56 años de edad, tiene por actividad economica la venta y elaboracion de tiste y pozol productos elaborado con maiz, desde hace catorce años actividad que aprendio pro parte de su mama la cual elaborava dicha productos, hoy en dia  agueda  tiene mucha clientela su producto es muy demanddo, gracia a la calida del producto, el fiananciamiento lo  quiere para comprar maiz y elaborar el producto como: tiste, pozol, pinolillo, cacao, cereales entre otros.
texts.en: Agueda De Jesús is 56 years old and single. She has made a living making and selling corn-based products like tiste (a traditional drink) and pozole (traditional stew) for the past 14 years. She learned the trade from her mother, who also made the same products, and today Agueda has a lot of customers because her products are demand thanks to their quality. She is requesting the loan to purchase corn to make products like tiste, pozole, cornmeal, cocoa, cereal and other items.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make her products.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene  55 años de edad, es casada,  tiene un hijo, vive en el Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
La actividad que le ha generado ingresos desde hace 16 años es el negocio de venta de cal.  Doña florinda  compra la cal en cantidades en barriles, luego las  empaca en bolsa y la vende. Manifiesta que la venta de cal es muy rentable. Cuenta con sus propios compradores de este producto. 
Doña Florinda lleva cinco préstamos con Odef, actualmente solicita otro de 6,000 lempiras para abastecerse comprando 20 barriles de cal para la venta. Piensa que con esta inversión aumentara las ventas y sus ingresos serán aun mejores.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener una solvencia económica para cualquier necesidad prioritaria que se presente en el futuro.
texts.en:
Florinda is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

For the past 16 years, she has generated income through her business of selling lime powder. Doña Florinda buys quantities of lime powder in barrels and then packs the product in bags for eventual resale. She says that selling lime powder is very profitable and has her own set of buyers for this products.

Doña Florinda has received five loans from ODEF. She is currently requesting another one in the amount of 6,000 HNL so that she can restock her business by purchasing 20 barrels of lime powder for resale. Florinda believes this investment will increase her sales and result in better income. Her goal is to continue growing her business. She wants to achieve financial solvency so that she can be prepared for any priority that presents itself in the future.

loans.use: to buy 20 barrels of lime powder to sell.

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny tiene 46 años, está casado con Betty, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. 
Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 18 años, por eso menciona que es experto en las labores del campo, a pesar de esfuerzo físico. “Limpiar es cansado, por eso contrato personal para machetear todas mis parcelas”, dice. Cuenta con seis cuadras de terrenos donde produce exclusivamente frutas cítricas como naranjas, mandarinas, limones, tanyarinas (injerto), tanyelos (Injerto) y otros. Su ventaja es que los compradores llegan hasta sus terrenos con camiones para llevarse sus productos, así él ahorra en el pago de transporte y personal de carga. A Danny le agrada su trabajo, por eso continuará con sus cultivos y atenderá con más esmero sus frutos cítricos.

Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Huacamayo” es el nombre de su banco comunal, donde todos los socios son personas responsables.
Destinará este dinero a la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico y al pago de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de la mala hierba.
texts.en: Danny is 46 years old and married to Betty, with whom he has four children. He has made a living in agriculture for the past 18 years, so he says that he is an expert in working in the fields despite the physical exertion. "Cleaning is tiresome, so I hire workers to clear my lands," he said. He has six plots of land exclusively producing citrus fruits like oranges, mandarins, lemons, tangerines, tangelos and other items. His advantage is that the buyers come to his land with trucks to take out his products, so he saves money on transportation costs. Danny enjoys his work, so he will continue working and tending to his citrus fruits with care. This is his seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time. “Huacamayo” is the name of his community bank, where all the members are responsible people. He plans to use the money to purchase bags of organic fertilizer and to pay the laborers to clear his land of weeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay laborers to work on his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando el negocio de compra y venta de carros viejos y tambien vende cosas viejas chatarras,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de carros y tambien vende chatarras.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para carros y tambien cosas viejas como muebles,ventanas y cocinas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Leoncio continues with his business buying and selling old cars and scrap metal. He works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. His dream is to expand his business, and he is requesting the loan to purchase spare car parts as well as old things like furniture, windows and kitchen items. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase spare car parts and old things like furniture, windows and kitchen items.

loans.name: Khikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина, она замужем и любящая мать семерых детей. Она хорошая женщина и всегда заботиться о благосостоянии в своем доме. Более 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей детской и женской одежды, а также женских тканей. В бизнесе помогает ей её заботливая дочка. Хикоят в основном приобретает товар на центральном рынке «Корвон». Данный момент Хикоят хочет закупить новый ассортимент детской и женской одежды. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони. Она надеется на вашу помощь и щедрость.
texts.en: Khikoyat is a hardworking and goal oriented woman. She is married and is a loving mother of seven children. She is a good woman and always cares about the well-being of her home. For more than ten years she has been reselling children's and women's clothing as well as women's fabrics. Her caring daughter is helping her in the business. Khikoyat mainly buys the merchandise on the central market Korvon. At this time Khikoyat wants to buy a new assortment of children's and women's clothing. With this purpose she is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni. She is hoping for your help and generosity.

loans.use: to buy new assortment of clothes.

loans.name: Charo

texts.es:
La socia Charo nació en el distrito de Coya pero vive en la ciudad de Calca, ella tiene 34 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. (Coya se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad de la ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 
La socia Charo pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta días en las oficinas de la ciudad de Calca. La socia Charo se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y tiene una pequeña librería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. 

La socia Charo en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, colores, fólderes, papel y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Charo lives in the city of Calca, but was born in the district of Coya, which is 10 minutes from Calca and is known for beautiful countrysides and tourism, cattle ranching and agriculture. She is 34, married and has two children. 

Charo belongs to the village bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", part of the Araiwa Assocation. They meet every 30 days in the offices in the city of Calca. Charo sells stationary supplies and has a small store. She has been doing this for several years and it's going well thanks to her hard work.

On this occasion, Charo is accessing a loan to buy merchandise like notebooks, pens, erasers, folders, paper and other things.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like notebooks, pencils, erasers, colored pencils, folders, paper and other things.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia Esther continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa como pantalones,chompas,casacas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a la vez  continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza vendiendo de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y familiares, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas ropa como casacas.
texts.en:
Esther continues with her business buying and selling clothing like pants, sweaters, jackets and other things. She has been doing this work for awhile and it's going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day. She also continues with her business selling beauty products door to door to customers like friends and relatives. This is how she is getting her family ahead. 

She asks for a loan to buy more clothing like jackets.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like jackets.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa continues with her grocery store business, where she sells basic goods like rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies. She works from 7:00 am to 10:00pm. This business is how she helps her children to get ahead. Her dream is to increase the size of her grocery store. She requests a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies in bulk.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies at wholesale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de Yanatile pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Calca, ella tiene 27 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. (Coya se encuentra a 10 minutos de la ciudad de la ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 

La socia Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta. La socia Luz Marina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, pan y otras cosas más. 

La socia Luz Marina en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in the city of Yanatile but currently lives in the city of Calca. She is 27 years old and has a partner with whom she has 2 children. (Coya is 10 minutes from the city of Calca and is known for beautiful countrysides and for being an area of tourism, cattle ranching and farming).

Luz Marina belongs to the village bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", part of the Association Arariwa, which meets every 30 days. Luz Marina sells basic goods like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, bread and other things.

On this occasion, Luz Marina is accessing a loan to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, noodles and other things.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, noodles and other things.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Anyar Sari 2 group is a group of women with 10 members. The group is located in the Sangketan village, in the middle part of Bali. This is the second group in this area. The group consists of 10 women who all have the same business of pig breeding. Although they already have main jobs, they run this business to support their family income. Most of them primarily work as farmers or have small kiosks.

Ni Made, as the head of the group, coordinated the group to get a loan and training from MUK. They need the loan to continue and increase the business, as well as the training to improve their knowledge in pig breeding. Ni Made will use the loan to purchase four local pigs for pig roll (pigs barbeque, keeps only for two months and then ready to sell).

She has a plan to save the profit to support her children's educations. Two of the members resigned from the group and were replaced by a new member.

loans.use: To purchase four local pigs for pig roll.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She runs a restaurant that has been in operation for 20 years. She is a mother of four children, most of whom are adults; only one child is still in school. She saved money and used it as start-up capital for the business. Besides this business, Jane also earns some income from the rental houses she owns. She employs 10 staff in her business.

Jane learned of Milango from an officer and is asking for a loan of 41,850 shillings to purchase foodstuffs, e.g. cooking oil, flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc. Despite the challenge of the high cost of raw materials and price fluctuations, Jane aspires to open a hotel. She will use the extra income from this loan to repay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, e.g. cooking oil, flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a grocery stall that has been in operation for two years. Janet is a married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She started the business from her personal savings. In this business, she sells fish and potatoes.

Janet was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 36,650 Kenya shillings to purchase grocery stock, e.g. tomatoes, kale, cabbage, avocados, etc.
 
The business has been facing the challenge of the seasonal climate, especially due to the lack of rain, which reduces the supply of farm produce. Her ambition is to purchase a canter (a light-duty commercial vehicle) for the supply of farm produce in the near future. Janet states that the additional income from this loan will help pay for her children’s school fees and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock, e.g. tomatoes, kale, cabbage, avocados, etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has one child. Michael owns a food café that has been in operation for two years. He also supplies cakes to the nearby shops. 

Michael was introduced to Milango by his neighbors and joined in order to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more flour and foodstuffs for the café. His aspiration is to be a well-known supplier of cakes in the region.

Michael will use the additional income from this loan to purchase a motorcycle for the transportation/supply of cakes to a wider area and to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and foodstuffs for the café.

loans.name: Las Gardenias De Jamiltepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Gardenias de Jamiltepec y está conformando por catorce mujeres indígenas originarias de un pueblo del estado de Oaxaca llamado Santiago Jamiltepec, tierra rica en tradiciones.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Luisa Raquel, mejor conocida como Doña Raquel de cincuenta y dos años. Doña Raquel se dedica a la venta de moldes de plástico por catálogo desde hace siete años, es vendedora ambulante. Una de las cosas que más le gusta de su negocio es que le deja muy buenas ganancias y cuando ella compra los mismos productos con el distiubuidor, puede llegar a tener descuentos de 30%. Doña Raquel emprendió esta actividad gracias a su amiga Cecilia quien la invitó a unirse a las ventas por catálogo ya que es una forma de administrar su propio tiempo sin descuidar a su hija.

Una de las experiencias más fuertes para Doña Raquel, es enfrentar la enfermedad de su hija Claudia de veinticinco años de edad, quien sufre de retraso mental. Doña Raquel menciona que su hija Claudia es el motor que la mueve para seguir adelante y enfrentar todo sus obstáculos. Para Raquel, una de las características que debe tener para realizar ventas por catálog es ser responsable, amable, tener poder de convencimiento y, sobre todo, ser activa. Además, dice que se considera una persona especial por enfrentar los problemas con valentía y por el hecho de que no se deja vencer tan fácilmente. Raquel pidió su crédito para comprar más moldes de plástico para la venta ya que los paquetes que compra le cuestan aproximadamente dos mil cuatrocientos pesos; de esta forma podrá tener ejemplares para mostrar y ayudar a convencer a los clientes. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Adelfa - se dedica a la venta de pan.
María Adelfa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Idolina- se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Gaudencia- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Lucía- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Soledad- se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Raquel- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ana María- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Rosa-se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Cristina- se dedica a la venta de plásticos.
Adriana- se dedica a la venta de pan.

Todas ellas le dan las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudarlas a invertir en su negocio y aprovechar mejor sus ganancias.
texts.en:
