This group is named The Jamiltepec Gardenias, it is made up of fourteen indigenous women originally from the state of Oaxaca called Santiago Jamiltepec, a land rich in traditions.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Luisa Raquel, better known as Doña Raquel, she is 52 years old. Doña Raquel has sold plastic molds by catalogue for some 7 years, she is a street vendor. One of the things she enjoys most about her work is very good profits since she buys the products from the distributor and gets up to a 30% discount. Doña Raquel started this job thanks to her friend, Cecilia, who invited her to sell items by catalogue since it is a way for her to manage her own time without neglecting her daughter.

One of the most challenging experiences that Doña Raquel has faced is her daughters’ illness. Claudia is 25 years old and is mentally challenged. Doña Raquel mentions that her daughter is the motor that drives her to get ahead in life and to face all of her obstacles. For Raquel, one of the characteristics that she has to have for her work is to be a responsible, kind, knowledgeable, and overall active person. She considers herself to be a special person since she faces her problems with courage and does not give up easily. Raquel needs the loan to buy more plastic molds to sell since the packages that she buys cost about twenty-four hundred pesos, she will then have examples to show and which will help her convince customers to buy her products.

The other members of the group are: Adelfa - sells bread María Adelfa- sells Mexican treats. Idolina- sells cheese. Gaudencia- sells groceries. Elizabeth- sells food. Lucía- sells bread. Soledad- sells cheese. Raquel- sells refreshments. Catalina- sells clothing. Ana María- sells groceries. Rosa- sells clothing. Cristina- sells plastic merchandize. Adriana- sells bread.

All of the members are grateful to Vision Fund for helping them invest in their businesses and to take better use of their earnings.

loans.use: buy plastic containers.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La socia Grimaneza nació en la ciudad de Yanatile pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Calca, ella tiene 31  años edad y tiene un hijo. (La ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 

La socia Grimaneza pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de jugos y le va muy bien gracias al desempeño que pone en su negocio. La socia Grimaneza se dedica a la venta de jugos de diferentes tipos de frutas como por ejemplo de naranja, papaya, plátano y otras más. 

La socia Grimaneza en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo naranjas, plátanos, papayas y otras más.
texts.en:
Grimaneza was born in the city Yanatile, but currently lives in the city of Calca. She is 31 years old and has one child. (The city of Calca is known for having beautiful landscapes as well as being an area for tourism, livestock breeding, and agriculture.)

Grimaneza is a member of the Communal Bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. The meetings are held every 30 days. Grimaneza has been selling juices for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her business. She sells different types of juices such as orange, papaya, banana, and other flavors.

Grimaneza is taking this opportunity to access a loan in order to buy supplies such as oranges, bananas, papayas, and other fruits.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, papayas, and other fruits for making juices.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a cafe that has been in operation for 10 years. Out of this business, Zuhura has been able to support her family of one husband and two children, both of whom are in school. In this café, she sells meat, fish and cooked cereals.

The number of customers visiting her business has increased, putting pressure on her existing facilities. 

The main aim of this loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings is to pay for her children’s school fees. She believes that she will then be able to put more focus into her business. Zuhura’s desire is to have an enclosed place from where she can sell the food; she has currently been selling in an open space.

loans.use: To pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a fruit supplier who lives in the Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. In this business, Wilfred sells mangoes, avocados, bananas, etc., within the Kongowea market, the largest open-air market in Kenya. He has been running the business for the last 10 years. Besides this business, Wilfred also owns a retail shop.

He learned of Milango from a friend and is applying for a loan of 31,450 shillings to purchase avocados and mangoes. He has the ambition of supplying the produce to various parts of the country.

Wilfred will use the extra income from the business to improve the standard of living of the family despite the challenge of the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: To purchase avocados and mangoes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is single and has been running a beauty salon for five years. She also owns a barber shop.

Susan was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase salon stock and equipment including a hair dryer, chairs, braids, cosmetics and hair relaxers.

The challenges she faces in this business are high stock and rental fees, and power outages. Susan intends to overcome this by saving the additional income from the loan and upgrading the type of equipment she uses in her business. 

Her future ambitions include setting up a beauty training college and building her own business premises. Her immediate desire is to be able to access better medical services.

loans.use: To buy stock and equipment including a hair dryer, chairs, braids, cosmetics, and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Hawa from Moriba town in the southern area of Bo. She is widowed with 2 children aged 10 years and 23 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Hawa established her Table business (selling local foodstuffs). She sells raw rice, pepper, Maggi food products, salt and palm oil. She started her business because she is a single parent and wants to generate income to support her family. 

She works 10 hours a day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge in her business is that when there are fewer sales, some perishable goods will deteriorate and the business will run at a loss.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs like raw rice, palm oil, Maggi, pepper and tomato seeds. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs such as raw rice, palm oil, Maggi food products, pepper, and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Elizabeth from Moriba town in Bo, in the southern area. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 6 and 25 years old. Four of her children attend school. 

Elizabeth runs a business selling wood and charcoal. She has been running this business for 2 years. She works 13 hours a day and 7 days per week. Her husband is a village pastor, and he helps her support the family with the money he receives from the church. 

Elizabeth says that the main challenges in her business are that transportation costs are high and the road network is poor.

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal and wood to store, because during the rainy season charcoal will be scarce. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and give her children a good quality education. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamilette, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad tiene por actividad economica la venta de mercaderia en general, tiene varios años de trabajar con fundacion leon 2000m, juana inico con capital propio  y gracias al apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado es que ha podido sacar adelante, a su familia y su negocio, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar mercaderia para sastifacer a su clientela como : blusas, calcetines, sabanas, pantalones, ropa de niño, perfumeria, zapatos entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Yamilette is married and has two young children. Her business involves selling general merchandise. Juana has worked with Fundación León 2000 for several years.

She started out with her own capital and thanks to the support that Fundación León 2000 has provided, Juana has been able to help her family and her business move forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to satisfy her customers. These items include blouses, socks, bed sheets, trousers, children's clothing, perfumes, shoes, and other products.

loans.use: to buy blouses, socks, bed sheets, trousers, children's clothing, perfumes, shoes, and other products.

loans.name: Jacqulyn

texts.en: Jacqulyn is 32 years old. She owns a boutique where she sells different items. Besides that, she grows vegetables and has been a vegetable grower for the past years. She would like to request this loan to add more new items in the boutique such as sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Abrahn

texts.es:
El socio Abrahn nació en la ciudad de Calca y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 33 años edad y es soltero y aun no tiene hijos. (La ciudad de Calca y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). 

El socio Abrahn pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones son cada treinta. El socio Abrahn se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes urbano en su propio  mototaxi. 

El socio Abrahn en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para hacer mantenimiento del mototaxi ósea va arreglar el motor pues no está funcionando bien.
texts.en:
Abrahn was born in the city of Calca and still lives there. He is 33 years old, single, and has no children. (The city of Calca is known for having beautiful landscapes as well as being an area for tourism, livestock breeding, and agriculture.)

Abrahn is a member of the Communal Bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. The meetings are held every 30 days. Abrahn provides urban transportation services with the use of his own motorcycle taxi.

He is taking this opportunity to access a loan in order to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi and repairs to the engine which is not functioning properly.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and engine repairs.

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en: Didacienne is 45 years old. She is a widow with five children. Three of them are her own children and she takes care of two other children from her relatives. All of them go to school. With the loan she wants to buy more maize and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Luvy Maria

texts.es: Luvy maria, casada de 50 años de edad, de la localidad de leon, tiene por actividad bar y comedor  la cual tiene experiencia de dies años, actividada que inico con una herramienta de trabajo  para tener un  medio de ingresos propios, en la actualidad ella ha logrado metas y obejectivos personales, gracia a su negocio y el finanaciamiento lo quiere para la compra de productos para el negocio como:  licores  de diferentes sabores, gaseosas, refrescos, carnes de diferente tipos para elaboracion de platillos, platanos, frijoles licuados,  maduros queso, para la elaboracion de platos variados.
texts.en:
Luvy Maria is 50 years old, married, and has an establishment in León. She manages a bar and diner. Luvy Maria has 10 years of experience and this business is the only source of work by which she is able to generate her own income. At the moment, she has accomplished her goals and personal objectives thanks to her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her business such as liquors of different flavors, sodas, soft drinks, meats of different types, bananas, refried beans, and hard cheeses for preparing various dishes.

loans.use: to buy liquor, sodas, soft drinks, meat, bananas, refried beans, hard cheeses, and other supplies.

loans.name: C 8093 Ntucogore Group

texts.en:
Bernard is 26 years old, is married with one child and takes care of two relatives. He owns a construction supply business. Bernard is a leader of this group, which is called "C 8093 NTUCOGORE" in the local language; the name means "Don't give up" in English. In the photo, he's in the middle. He has been in this business for two years and he works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, every week. Bernard currently employs one person to help him. 

Bernard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his construction supply business by buying various materials for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his construction supply business by buying various materials for resale.

loans.name: Elisaphane

texts.en: Elisaphane is 30 years old. He is single. With the loan, he wants to buy more rice, salt, and soaps, as well as cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used for buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive is aged 42. She is married and has six children aged between seventeen and twenty-two. Five of them completed high school. 

She has been selling bananas for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to add more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 36 years old. She is married with one child. After the accomplishment of paying her previous loan, she planned to start a new business of selling foodstuffs, such as beans and sorghum.  With the loan, she wants to buy beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a business store.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell such as beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 37 years old.  She is the mother of two children.  Her husband is a house builder and helps the wife in the business sometimes. When the husband doesn't have a job, he prefers to assist his wife as he has been doing that in the previous years.  She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell.  She will use the profits from the business to build a house on the plot of land she bought recently.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children. She sells different foodstuffs such as beans, maize, and sorghum. She has been in the business for a period of four months. She diverted from the previous business recently to start this new business of foodstuffs. With the loan, she has requested she wants to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Takku Liggey 3 Kahone Group

texts.fr: Le groupe"Takku liggey 3 kahone" qui se compose de cinq femmes mariées a été crée il y a deux ans.Ces membres s'activent dans le commerce en détails de vêtements pour femmes et enfants.Ils s'approvisionnent dans la capitale située à 82 km de leur localité.Elles revendent en détail leur marchandise soit à domicile ou dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui se tiennent tout le long de la semaine dans leur région.Cette activité leur rapporte des bénéfices qui leur servent à la prise en charge de leurs besoins mais aussi et surtout à l'alimentation de la famille .Le chef de groupe (en rouge)a installé une cantine en fer devant son domicile pour y vendre ses marchandises.Elle propose à ses clients des pantalons, des robes et des pagnes tissées. Elles est mère de trois enfants dont elles supporte tous les frais de scolarité et les dépenses d'habillement. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter  des vêtements.
texts.en:
Takku Liggey 3 Kahone Group comprises five married women and was established two years ago. Its members retail women's and children's clothing.

They get their supplies in the capital, located 82 km from their town. They resell retail either at their home, or on the weekly markets taking place all along the week in their region.

The income earned from their businesses enables the members of the group to provide for themselves, and most importantly, feed their families.

The group leader (in red) built a stand in front of her home to sell her merchandise. She offers her customers pants, dresses and woven pagnes (colorful African wax cloth). She is the mother of three children, whose school fees and clothing expenses she covers. 

In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Antoinette Marie

texts.fr:
Antoinette Marie est une veuve âgée de 51 ans, mère de 07 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 20 et 31 ans et parmi lesquels un seul va encore à l'école. elle héberge à son domicile certains de ses petits fils. elle mène une activité de vente de vivres secs (arachide, haricot, farine de couscous) dans un marché de la place depuis 31 ans. elle s'approvisionne dans les banlieues de la ville et parfois sur place. avec ce crédit, elle voudrait avec renforcer ses fonds non seulement pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandise, mais aussi pour acheter du plantain et manioc en grande quantité afin de mieux répondre aux sollicitations de sa clientèle.
elle compte réinvestir les revenus supplémentaires générés dans son activité pour la faire grandir afin d'occuper à terme une position de leader dans ce marché et mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses petits fils.
texts.en:
Antoinette Marie is a 51 year old widow and the mother of seven children ranging in age from 20 to 31 years. One of them still attends school.   Some of her grandchildren live with her in her home.  She has been running a business selling dry food (peanuts, beans, coucous) in a local market for 31 years.   She gets her supplies in the outskirts of town and sometimes on location.  With this loan, she would like to increase her working capital, not only to increase her stock of merchandise but also to buy large quantities of plantains and manioc to better respond to her customers' demands. 
She plans to reinvest the additional income generated from her business to build it up in order to take on a leadership position in the market, and to better meet the needs of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy dry food, plantains and manioc in large quantities.

loans.name: Julienne Vivianne

texts.fr: Julienne est une jeune femme de 36 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 20 ans, cinq de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle commercialise les arachides, l'huile et les noix de palme depuis cinq ans. son activité fonctionne à merveille, elle a juste un problème parce que la vente en détail rapporte peu. Elle aimerai augmenter ses stocks de marchandises en achetant les arachides en sacs et plusieurs bidons d'huile de palme. ce qui lui évitera les ruptures de stocks, et augmentera ses bénefices. Elle réinvestira une partie du bénéfice dans son activité pour acheter encore plus de marchandises,et économiser le reste pour aider son époux avec une partie de la scolarisation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Julienne is a 36 year old woman, married and the mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 20.  Five of her children still attend school.  She is a vendor in a market where she has been selling peanuts, oil, and palm nuts for five years.  Her business is booming; her only problem is that selling retail brings only a small profit.  She would like to increase her supplies of merchandise by buying sacks of peanuts and several barrels of palm oil. This will help her to avoid shortages of stock as well as increase her income.  She will reinvest a portion of her profit in her business to buy even more merchandise and save the rest to help her husband with a portion of their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanuts and several barrels of palm oil

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Marie Claire est une jeune femme de 25 ans, célibataire, sans enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans où elle commercialise le poisson fumé et l'huile de palme. c'est une activité qui ne rapporte pas quand on  achète en détail, le bénéfice est vraiment minime et les ruptures de stocks sont permanente parce qu'elle est obligé faire écouler tout son petit stock pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner, les frais de transport sont élevés d'où son envie de faire le  gros, en achetant plusieurs bidons d'huile et cartons de poissons fumés ce qui limitera ses ruptures de stocks,réduira son coût de transport des marchandises, augmentera son capital, ses ventes et donc son bénéfice.Elle ne sera plus obligé de tout vendre avant de pouvoir se réapprovisionner Elle réinvestissera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité pour devenir grossiste plus tard.
texts.en: Marie Claire is a 25 year old single woman without children.  She is a vendor in a local market where she has been selling smoked fish and oil for five years.  The business is not very profitable when buying merchandise in small quantities. The profit is really minimal and Marie Claire constantly runs out of stock because she has to sell her entire stock in order to be able to stock up again. Transportation costs are also high. For these reasons, she would like to buy larger quantities of stock: several barrels of oil and cases of smoked fish. This will limit her stock shortages, reduce transportation costs and increase her capital and sales and therefore her profit. She will no longer have to sell all of her stock before being able to stock up again.  She will reinvest the profits that this loan will bring in her business in order to become a wholesaler in the future

loans.use: to buy several barrels of oil and cases of smoked fish

loans.name: Marlne

texts.en: Marlne is 66 years old. She is a mother of four children. She sells a variety of items in her little store. With the loan, she plans to buy more cooking oil, sugar, and salt to sell. Previously, she was making andazi but she has a plan of selling the new items as mentioned above for the new loan. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business. In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Elizabeth from Moriba town southern area Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of ten and twenty-five. Her husband is a taxi driver. At the end of the day, he makes little money; her children are currently attending school. 

Isatu runs a petty trading business within a busy market area. She sells ground nuts, palm oil and rice. She has been running this business for 30 years. She works at the business 10 hours a day and 7 days per week. She also earns income from small-scale farming in the village. At present she is facing the problem of insufficient capital to run the business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more local commodities such as ground nuts, palm oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more local commodities such as ground nuts, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Greda Traders Group

texts.en:
Greda traders are a group with four males and 13 females. Their average age is 36 years and average number of children is two. 

They sell commodities like cassava, plantain, yam, maize (grain), Sprite, Coca-Cola, corn, charcoal, palm oil, carpentry services and fish. They are married and living in Teshie. The total amount they need is 9,300 GHS. 

Joseph (second from right, squashing), buys his rice, sugar and Milo from the depot. He plans to own a retail shop of provisions. His kiosk is at the central market of Accra. He can make a profit margin of 80 GHS monthly. Part of this profit is for reinvestment and part is for completion of his building project.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and Milo to sell at his kiosk.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants .Deux des enfants fréquent l'école.Elle exerce un commerce de produits alimentaires à domicile.Parallèlement à cela, elle a installée devant sa maison un babyfoot qu'elle loue aux enfants qui veulent l'utiliser pour jouer.Ce jeu lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de renforcer les dépenses alimentaires de sa famille et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins.Afin d'acheter un nouvel babyfoot pour satisfaire la forte demande, elle sollicite un pret d 300000f.
texts.en:
Aminata is a married woman who has four children, two of whom go to school. She works selling food products from her home. She has also set up a table football table in front of her house, which she rents to children who want to use it to play. This brings her fairly consistent income, which she uses for her family’s food needs and to meet the majority of her own needs. 

Aminata has requested a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a new football table to meet the high demand.

loans.use: To buy a new table football table.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine une maman Camerounaise âgé de 52 ans, divorcé elle a 5 enfants âgés entre 30 et 18 ans dont un va à l'école. elle a également à sa charge 03 neveux qui vont à l'école. elle est Commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 20 ans où elle vend des vivres frais notamment les tubercule manioc et les légumes, elle s'approvisionne en brousse deux fois par semaines. Avec le crédit, Justine voudrait acheter les légumes et tubercules en grande quantités afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. les bénéfices tirés de cette augmentation seront d'une part réinjectés dans son activité et d'autre part serviront à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Justine is a 52-year-old mother from Cameroon. She is divorced and has five children aged between 18 and 30, one of whom goes to school. She also has three nephews under her care, who also go to school. 

Justine has worked for 20 years selling fresh food items in a local market. She mainly sells tubers, cassava and vegetables, and gets her supplies from the country twice a week. With her loan, she plans to buy large quantities of vegetables and tubers to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She will use part of the profits generated from this increase to reinvest in her business, and the other part to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Ugpr N°3 Takku Liggey Same Group

texts.fr: Le groupe"Ugpr n°3 takku liggey same" est composé de six femmes toutes mariées.Elles exercent un commerce de produits ménagers.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus assez intéressants qui leur permet de subvenir à leurs besoins mais aussi de renforcer les conditions alimentaires de leurs familles respectives.Afin d'augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits ménagers.
texts.en:
The "Ugpr no. 3 Takku Liggey Same" group has six female members, all of whom are married. They work selling household products, which gives them significant income to meet their needs, and also to provide for the food requirements of their respective families. 

The group’s members have requested a loan of 250,000 francs to increase their working capital, which they will use to buy household items.

loans.use: To buy household products.

loans.name: Utii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndamuso est une femme dynamique ; âgée  de 28ans ; mariée à un fonctionnaire de l'État et mère de 4enfants dont  3 scolarisés. Membre du  groupe de crédit Utii depuis plus de 3ans. Elle  est  à son  12ème cycle de crédit avec un capital de 1000$.  Elle compte acheter  10 cartons de piles et 10 cartons de cigarettes  avec le crédit sollicité  pour la croissance  de son affaire. Elle implore la continuité de crédit de  Hekima et ses partenaires et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en:
Ndamuso is a dynamic woman. She is 28 years of age, married to a government employee, and has four children, three of whom are at school. She has been a member of the Utii credit group for three years, and this is her 12th loan cycle with a loan of $1,000. 

Ndamuso plans to buy ten boxes of batteries and ten cases of cigarettes with the loan she has requested, so that she can expand her business. She hopes that the loans from Hekima and its partners will continue, and asks God to bless her more.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of batteries and 10 cases of cigarettes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aline Silviane

texts.fr: Aline est une jeune Camerounaise de 30 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfants de 02 ans et demi. elle a également à sa charge sa petite soeur de 22 ans. commerçante dans un marché de la place, Aline vend des boissons hygiéniques, de l'eau et parallèlement elle vend des vêtements de seconde main.Avec ce crédit la cliente voudrait acheter un congélateur afin de mieux conserver la boisson de même acheter des vêtements . une partie des bénéfices supplémentaires générés sera utilisé pour agrandir son activité et l'autre partie pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Elle a pou ambition de construire une maison dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Aline is a young, 30-year-old woman from Cameroon. She is single, and has two children aged two and a half. Her younger sister, who is 22, is also under her care.

Aline works in a local market selling hygienic drinks and water. She also sells second-hand clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy a freezer to better preserve her drinks, and also to buy clothing. Part of her additional profits will be used to expand her business, with the other part being used to provide for her family. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Alen

texts.fr: Alen est un jeune Camerounais de 31 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 08 ans, il vend des chaussures femmes. Avec ce crédit alen voudrait acheter des babouches des femmes afin de renforcer son stock et satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et exigeante. les bénéfices tirés de cette augmentation seront réinjectés dans son activité d'une part et d'autre par lui permettront dans l'avenir d’acquérir une boutique.
texts.en:
Alen is a young, 31-year-old man from Cameroon. He is single, and has no children. For the past eight years he has worked selling women’s shoes in a local market. 

Alen plans to use his loan to buy traditional women’s slippers to increase his stock, and to meet the needs of his ever-growing, demanding customer base. He will use part of the profits this increase generates to invest in his business, and will use the other part to buy a store in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de granos como trigo,habas y cebada,el socio vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el Cusco,tambien tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi,por medio de estos pequeños negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los granos y tambien mejorar en su negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar trigo,cebadas y habas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in his business buying and selling grains such as wheat, broad beans and barley.  He makes his sales in the different street markets in Cusco.  He also has a car which he uses to provide a taxi service.  Through these two small businesses, he provides for his children.  The member's dream is to have business premises from which he can sell his grains.  He would also like to improve his taxi business.  He is requesting this loan to buy wheat, barley and broad beans.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley and broad beans

loans.name: Begues

texts.fr: Begues est un jeune Camerounais de 32 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant d'un an six mois. Commerçant dans un marché de la place, Begues vend les chaussures femmes depuis 05 ans.Avec le crédit, il souhaite acheter les chaussures afin d'augmenter son stock et par conséquent son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices engendrés par cette augmentation lui permettront d'une part de soutenir sa famille et d'autre part d'acheter dans l'avenir une boutique.
texts.en:
Begues is a young, 32-year-old man from Cameroun. He is single and is father to a 6-month old child. 

Begues works selling women’s shoes in a local market, and has done so for the past five years. He plans to use his loan to buy shoes to increase his stock and, as a result, his sales. He will use part of the profits generated by this increase to support his family, and the other part to buy a store in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Nafabe Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA est la responsable du groupe NAFABE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants .Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 09ans.02 vont  à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend  du dèguè depuis 18ans. Elle s’approvisionne à côté du rondpoint de la patte d’oie en ville.ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de lait, 01 sac de sucre et 01 sac de couscous pour la fabrication du dèguè.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut acheter des céréales. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Salamata is head of the NAFABE group. She is married and mother to two children, the oldest of whom is 14 and the youngest 9 years of age. Two of her children go to school, and she has four people under her care.

Salamata has worked selling “dèguè” (a traditional African porridge) for the past 18 years. She gets her supplies by the roundabout at the junction in her village, and her customers are friends and neighbors.

Salamata wants to buy one container of milk, one bag of sugar and one bag of couscous to make dèguè. She wants to use her profits to buy cereals, and she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy one container of milk, one bag of sugar and one bag of couscous to make the traditional African dish “dèguè”.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming inputs

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur 1 Group

texts.fr:
"SOP SA DIEUKEUR 1" est un groupe de solidarité qui se compose de femmes pour la plupart mariées et mères de famille. Elles s'activent dans le commerce de tissus, d'habits et d'articles de mercerie.Elles achètent en gros pour amoindrir les frais et se partagent les marchandises en fonction de la part de chacune dans le capital.
Ce commerce leur permet de subvenir à leurs besoins mais aussi et surtout de participer à côté de leurs maris à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 450000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.
texts.en: "SOP SA DIEUKEUR 1" is a community bank made up of women who are mostly married and mothers.  They work selling fabric, outfits and sewing supplies.  They buy wholesale in order to reduce their expenses and then share the merchandise out according to how much money each member put in.  This business allows them to cover their needs but also, above all, it allows them to work alongside their husbands in covering their family expenses and supporting their families.  In order to strengthen their working capital, they are requesting a loan for 450,000 francs to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies

loans.name: Ouilao Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALLASSANE est la responsable du groupe OUILAO. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a 04ans  et ne va pas à l’école. Il a 03 personnes en charge.

Mr vend des portables et accessoires depuis 06ans. Il s’approvisionne à  Zabre daaga. Ses clients sont ses amis, voisins. 

Il veut s’acheter  05 portables et 100 accessoires.

Mr veut épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne agrandir  son activité.
texts.en:
ALLASSANE is the leader of the Ouilao group.  He is married and the father of a 4-year-old child who does not go to school.  He has three people in his care.

Allassane has been selling cellphones and accessories for six years.  He stocks up in Zabre Daaga.  His customers are his friends and neighbors.  He would like to buy 5 cellphones and 100 accessories.

Allassane would like to save his profits.  He plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy five cellphones and 100 accessories

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia Asunta nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 50 años edad. (Paucartambo se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia Asunta se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, ella comprar maíz de diferentes lugares como por ejemplo de Calca, Urubamba y Lares. Ella con el maíz elabora jora de maíz para vender a sus vecinas o compañeras del banco comunal que tienen como actividad principal hacer Chicha de Jora. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia Asunta requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. Asunta es una mujer luchadora y su sueño sacar profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Asunta is 50 years old and was born in the city of Paucartambo, in Cusco department.  (Paucartambo is three hours from the city of Cusco).  Asunta currently lives in the city of Calca.  She is married and has three children from her marriage.  (The city of Calca is noted for its beautiful countryside and for the fact that tourism, livestock raising and farming are common in this area).  Asunta is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Clorinda Matto de Turner" community bank.

Asunta's business is buying and selling corn.  She buys corn from different places such as Calca, Urubamba and Lares.  She uses the corn to make 'jora' (malted corn) to sell to her neighbors or fellow group members whose main business activity is making 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink).  She has been in this business for 15 years and is doing very well thanks to the determination with which she carries out her work.  On this occasion, Asunta needs her loan to buy corn.  She is a hard-working woman whose dream is to help her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de anticuchos es como una carne a la parrilla sevido con papas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los anticuchos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar los anticuchos como carne,aceite y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues working in her anticuchos business. 'Anticuchos' are grilled, skewered meat served with potatoes. She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor. She works from 5.00pm to 11.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children. This member's dream is to have business premises from which to sell her anticuchos. She is requesting this loan to buy products for making her anticuchos such as meat, oil and potatoes. The member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for making 'anticuchos' such as meat, oil and potatoes

loans.name: Sect 28 Amour Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est la représentante du groupe SECT 28 AMOUR. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants .Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02ans.02 vont à l’école .Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits pour enfants depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et au grand marché en ville.ses clients sont ses amis, ses  voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 05 douzaines d’habits pour enfants.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne vendre aussi des pagnes et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATI is the representative of SECT 28 AMOUR Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 14, and the youngest is two years old. Two of her children attend school. She has three persons to support.

Mrs. FATI has been selling children's clothing for six years. She gets her supplies at the Secteur 10 Market and at the Grand Market. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

She wants to buy five dozen items of children's clothing. With the profits, she would like to bolster her business. She ambitions to also sell pagnes (colorful African cloth) and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy five dozen items of children's clothing

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Lone! This is 42-year-old Haja from Moriba town, Bo southern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of four and nineteen. Haja's children currently attend school. 

Haja runs a dry fish business, and sells dry fish. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 10 hrs a day and 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from the little money her husband gives her for food. She describes her problem as being the poor road network. 

Haja has requested a loan in order to buy more dry fish. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to export dry fish overseas. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more dry fish.

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer de 47 años de edad, se describe como una persona tranquila, alegre y muy trabajadora. Zoila vive con sus hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Zoila trabaja sola en la venta de comida de la region que consta de mote, arbeja cocinada y carne horneada de cerdo, para lo cual realizó un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de granos como mote, arbeja también va a comprar cerdos para reproducción que le ayudará a producir mayor cantidad de carne y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos y de esta manera podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.

Zoila sueña con que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 47-year-old woman who describes herself as calm, cheerful and very hard working.  She lives with her children in Atuntaqui, 15 minutes from Ibarra, in Imbabura province.

Zoila works alone selling regional food.  She sells 'mote' (cooked, peeled corn kernels), 'arveja cocinada' (cooked peas) and roast pork.  She requested a loan from Fodemi to invest in buying grains such as 'mote' and peas.  She will also buy pigs to breed as this will help her to produce a larger quantity of pork and she will be able to increase her sales and income.  This will enable her to improve her quality of life.

Zoila dreams of her children finishing their education and becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed as her business is selling pork

loans.name: Tigingou Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est la responsable du groupe TIGINGOU. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants .Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 08ans.01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Mme vend du savon et des habits depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville.ses clients sont un peu partout dans la ville car ambulante.

Elle veut s’acheter 04 sacs de savon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un hangar au marché de nabig yaar.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATI is responsible for TIGINGOU Group. She's married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 13 years old, the youngest is 8. One of them attends school. She has two persons to support.

Mrs. FATI has been selling soaps and clothes for twelve years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 Market in the city. Her clients are everywhere in the city since she's a traveling saleswoman.

She wants to buy four sacks of soaps. With her profits, she wants to bolster her business. She ambitions to buy a hangar at the Nabig Yaar Market.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of soaps

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 42 años, está casada con José, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con una hija, la de 16 años. La casa donde viven es tipo rústica y se ubica en una comunidad nativa.
Desde los 15 años se dedica a la agricultura cuando ayudaba a sus padres a cosechar el café. Ahora cuenta con 6 parcelas; 5 de café, y una de yuca y plátanos. Con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores logra limpiar y cultivar todos sus productos, así se ahorra en el pago de personal. Toda su producción la comercializa en las cooperativas cafetaleras de la ciudad, en cuanto al plátano y la yuca los lleva hasta el mercado central para ofrecerlos. Menciona que le va bien en las ventas, porque estos productos siempre tienen demanda. Para más adelante, piensa comprarse un auto para movilizarse con facilidad, pero para eso continuará en las labores del campo para seguir ahorrando.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, y se siente a gusto de trabajar con socios optimistas.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de plantitas de café para renovar sus sembríos. Además pagará al personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and married to José.  The couple have five children but only live with one daughter, their 16 year old.  The house in which they live is rustic and located in an indigenous community.

Ana has been farming since she was 15 years old.  She used to help her parents harvest their coffee.  She now has six plots of land: five are sown with coffee and one with cassava and bananas.  With the help of her grown-up children, Ana manages to weed and grow all her crops which saves her money on paying workers.  She sells all of her produce to the coffee cooperatives in the city.  She sells her bananas and cassava in the central market.  Ana mentions that her sales are good because these products are always in demand.  In the future, she plans to buy a car so that she can get about easily.  In order to achieve this, she will continue working on her land so that she can continue saving up.

This is Ana's fifth loan from MFP.  She gives her word that she will make her loan repayments punctually.  She is a member of the 'Shantzoshis' community bank and feels happy working with such optimistic group members.

Ana will invest her loan money in buying coffee seedlings so that she can renew her plantings.  She will also pay staff who she will hire to weed her crops.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and to pay laborers who will work on her land

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mariama from Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of eight and twenty-five. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 1995, Mariama established her business. She began her business because she was brought up within a business environment; her sister assisted her to start up her fist business. She wakes up very early in the morning at 5:00 am to buy her goods from the next village. She works seven days per week she will not rest expect on public holidays. She says that the main challenges to her business are the poor road network, the scarcity of palm oil and the fact that she has to pay labor to fetch her goods to the point of sale. 

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and bags of gari. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Mariama plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and bags of gari.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay laborers who will work on her crops

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Abibatu from Torkpoi town. She is married with three children between the ages of 14 and 21. Abibatu's children are currently attending school. For the past ten years, she has run a general store where she sells soft drinks, water, and batteries. Abibatu began this business because, after working with an NGO supporting malnourished children, she decided to start a business. She works 12 hours a day seven days a week and her husband also earns an income. Abibatu's main business challenge is the scarcity of soft drinks.

Abibatu is requesting a loan to buy food stuff such as water, soft drinks, and provisions. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a bigger shop to sell more items. Abibatu appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Christiana from Moriba town, southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of seven and 18. Her children are currently attending school and she also has two additional dependent who live with her because they are relatives from the village. For the past 12 years, Christiana has been running a general store at a busy market area where she sells soft drinks, soap, milk, biscuits, and phone chargers. She began her business because her husband is a primary school teacher and his income was not enough to take care of their children. Christiana works 14 hours a day seven days per week. She also earns income from the rental of her family house. Christiana's main business challenge is the transportation of goods from town to her shop.

Christiana is requesting a loan to buy items such as soft drinks, milk, sugar, and cocoa. The extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and roof her house with new zinc. In the future, she plans to open another shop. Christiana appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Hawa from Moriba town southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of four and 13. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Hawa established her retail business to improve the life of her family. Her husband is a trader and Hawa works 10 hours a day, seven days a week. She has no holidays. Hawa is a hardworking woman and her business is going well. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy items for her business such as oil, maggie, salt, and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, cooking seasonings, and other items for her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

Liezel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Liezel has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Liezel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Margaret from Torkpoi town. She is married with four children between the ages of 28 and 35. For the past 15 years, Margaret has been running a general store inside the market square where she sells dried fish, pepper, bullion cubes, onions, and tomatoes. She began this business to create a permanent source of income to support her family. Margaret buys goods from a wholesaler at 4:00 am and works at her store from 8:00 am through 4:00 pm six days a week. Her major business challenge is transportation to buy fish.

Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more fish, bullion, and pepper. The extra income from her loan will allow her to start a savings account. In the future, Margaret plans to expand her business and improve her standard of living. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy dried fish, bullion, and pepper

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Patzicia Group

texts.en:
Feliza, a 36-year-old single mother of three, is a member of the Las Margaritas de Patzicia Trust Bank, which is located in Patzicia, a community within Chimaltenango, Guatemala. 

To support her family, Feliza and her children cultivate vegetables that she brings to the local market to sell.
 
Before having her own business, Feliza worked in other people's houses washing their clothes. Now she is very happy to run her own small business.

Feliza leaves her house very early in the morning to work in her fields, carrying her one-year old daughter on her back. Later in the morning she sells her vegetables. Feliza, who has had no formal education, believes that with a successful business, she will be able to support her children and provide them with a bright future.
 
Feliza has successfully completed her first loan with Friendship Bridge, a loan that helped her to continue running her business, as well as pay for household expenses and her children’s needs. Now Feliza is applying for her second loan, which she plans to use to buy vegetables in bulk, which will allow her to expand her business further. Feliza’s short-term dream is to devote herself to her vegetable business and provide a stable home for her children, allowing them to go to school.

Feliza’s Trust Bank, Las Margaritas Patzicia, is composed of eight women, most of whom are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry. Together, they participate in monthly educational lessons on business, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights, health and how to support their children’s education. These lessons, combined with their loans, help them to provide a better life for themselves and their families. The women of Las Margaritas Patzicia are grateful for the people who trust in them, enabling them to obtain loans for their businesses and overcome the poverty that surrounds them.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 63-year-old hardworking woman, living with her husband and her mother. She has developed a reputation for her nice cooking of tamales (a local dish) and roast pig, which she sells together with soft drinks. 

She established her small shop about five years ago and is still working hard to make it as nice as possible. Gloria also does take-away services and has a solid client base for her products. Moreover, to increase the income for the household, her husband works on a farm, growing corn and beans. 

She is now looking to take a loan of 1,000 PEN with Edpyme Alternativa to buy different goods for her small shop.

loans.use: to buy goods for her small shop in order to cope with increasing demand.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Arlene has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Lone! This is 49-year-old Baby from Moriba town, southern area in Bo. She is married with children between the ages of 11 and 20. Baby's children are currently attending school. For the past 15 years, she has been running a business where she sells clothes, wax cotton, lace, shirts, and slippers. Baby works 12 hours a day, six days a week and her business is her sole source of income. She says that her business is doing well. 

Baby is requesting a loan to buy more wax cotton, lace, shirts, and slippers. The extra income from her loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, Baby plans to open a shop in city. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy wax cotton, lace, shirts, and slippers

loans.name: Juan María

texts.en:
Juan Maria is a responsible, hardworking person who has previously taken loans from Edpyme Alternativa with Kiva's support. Indeed, he has punctually owned up to his previous commitments with these institutions. 

Given that he lives in a rural area with no access to basic services and which can be hard to reach for many other credit providers, the work that Edpyme and Kiva carry out in allowing access to capital for entrepreneurs like Juan Maria is crucial. 

He is 36 years old, with four children and living in Northern Peru. Outside his house he has land that he has used to grow lemons and mangos, with the lemon crop being commericalized on a  weekly basis. Moreover, he has a small area where he raises poultry to provide additional income for his children. He has dedicated more than 12 years of his life to these activities and has developed strong expertize in this field. Hence, he is now looking to take a loan in order to buy fertilizers and other organic products to protect his lemon crop during its consolidation period.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other organic products to protect his lemon crop during its consolidation period.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 52, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Faustino and is the mother of two children who are both already working. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Delia hopes to be able to expand the business soon. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Juditha has been in this business for 10 years and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.en:
Elena is a 50 year old woman, living in her own house where she has established a cafe. She lives in Northern Peru in a rural area near Tambogrande. She has developed a strong reputation as a reliable supplier of quality food that locals enjoy. She has been involved in this activity for the last six years.

Indeed, she has worked very hard to consolidate her small business and has previously taken out a loan with Edpyme Alternativa supported by Kiva, having used it to buy supplies for her shop. 

As the number of clients have increased and the range of food offered becomes wider, she now looks to make a second loan of 2000 PEN to buy a fridge. 

Rural areas are often harder to reach and as a result the incentive to provide them with access to credit is smaller for bigger capital providers. Hence, the role of Kiva and Edpyme for this type of client is particularly important.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store some of her products.
